results.description:
All slideshows take place at: The AMC Cabot Auditorium, 4 Joy St., Boston, MA 02108. Doors @ 6:15pm, potluck @ 6:30pm, slideshow @ 7:15pm

Jodee Varney set off with her sister, Heather, on June 15, 2015 to cross North America by bicycle. Prior to starting the trip, neither had ever been on a single overnight bike trip, and Heather's longest bike ride was less than 20 miles. They biked westbound from Boston to Seaside Oregon via many backroads and a few Interstate freeways, camping almost every night, while carrying 20-23 pounds of gear each. They met lots of real people, and visited some places that many of us have never heard of. Come see photo highlights, hear tales that may renew your faith in humanity, and learn about ultralight bicycle touring.

Potluck Info:
If you wish to participate in the potluck, homemade dishes are welcome, store bought goodies & takeout are equally welcome:) Plates, bowls, cups, cutlery, napkins and drink pitchers will be supplied. The auditorium has a kitchen if you need to do any re-warming or prep (w/stovetop, oven, microwave, sink & fridge). Please bring your own cooking pots if needed for stovetop.

Map & Public Transit:
Map: http://tinyurl.com/4JoyStMap
Take the MBTA Red or Green Lines, or the # 43 or #55 Bus, to Park Street Station. Walk through the Boston Common uphill towards the State House on Beacon St. To the left of the State House is Joy St; follow Joy St uphill to the AMC Auditorium Building (brownstone), #4 Joy St on the left hand side. This is Cabot Auditorium, which is located one building downhill from the main AMC headquarters of #5 Joy St. Look for the 'slideshow' signs on the door and fence.


Parking:
Nearby parking is available at the Boston Common Garage, located underneath the Boston Common. Access is off Charles St, between the Public Garden and the Boston Common. We offer discount parking passes for you to purchase at the show ($9 each, that's 50% off). More info about the Garage is here: http://bostonparking.spplus.com/boston-boston-common-garage-zero-charles-street-parking.html#Tab_coupon-rates

<a href="http://bostonparking.spplus.com/boston-boston-common-garage-zero-charles-street-parking.html#Tab_coupon-rates"></a>
results.name: Just a Bit Farther: Biking Across the USA - Potluck & Slideshow

results.description:
Are you interested in building iPhone apps or becoming an iOS developer but you’re not sure where to begin? In this class series, students will learn how to build an iPhone app using Swift (Apple’s new production language) through a mix of lecture-style presentations and hands-on coding exercises. Students will learn the basics of the Swift programming language in addition to learning Xcode, the program used to develop iOS applications. Towards the end of the class, each student will have built an iOS app and have an understanding of what it’s like to be an iOS developer.

Class Schedule

This class takes place over two weeks.


• Tuesday, May 10th (Class 1) - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

• Thursday, May 12th (Class 2) - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

• Tuesday, May 17th (Class 3) - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

• Thursday, May 19th (Class 4) - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

Note: This class will be limited to 20 students. Register early to secure your spot.


Who should take this class?

Previous programming experience is not required but is a plus. However, if you have programming experience, keep in mind this is an introductory course that has been designed for students with very little to zero programming experience.

All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct. 


Pre-reqs & Preparation

You will need a Macintosh running OS X version 10.8 or newer. To find out which version you have, click on the Apple logo in the left corner of your screen. Click on “About This Mac."

Financial Need

A limited number of scholarships are available for those with a financial hardship. To apply, click here. Scholarship applicants will be notified shortly after the deadline. Check out this info sheet about getting course fees covered by your employer. 

Instructors

Jeff O'Leary is a mobile developer at Wayfair. His interest in computers and programming began at an early age and led him to a career in software development. After starting as a QA engineer, he soon transitioned into iOS and Android development. At Wayfair, Jeff is in charge of developing iOS apps and mentoring new engineers. Jeff loves his work and enjoys teaching with GDI.


Elliot Schrock is an entrepreneur, recovering mathematician, Raspberry Pi enthusiast, and mobile developer. After catching the programming bug way back in 7th grade, Elliot slowly came to the conclusion (over the course of a decade) that he should be making software for a living. He is now heading up iOS development at Trill, a local startup which curates all the live events in Boston (if it happens on a stage, we list it!). He is delighted to be a GDI teacher.

Interested in discovering classes like this, workshops, special events, giveaways, volunteer opportunities, and more? Sign up for our monthly newsletter!

results.description:
Lean enterprise, Agile, DevOps and Micro-services are drastically changing the way software products consume API's. In other words, API Economy is upon us! This gives birth to new challenges in testing. 

In this presentation we will discuss the typical bottlenecks in the Continuous Delivery pipeline that are associated with functional, integration and end-to-end testing and how to address them. 

The service virtualization approach will be demonstrated using Open Source and commercial projects and the improvement in the quality it yields. We will then discuss Data-Driver Testing and how it helps development and QA teams achieve full test automation and reduce the time spent on test development and maintenance. Finally, the process of planning, designing and implementing a virtualized service will be demonstrated and the related tools discussed.

This presentation will be given by:

Alex Seriy ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexseriy )

We look forward to seeing you all. I will provide soft drinks and pizza.

Agenda: 
6:30 - 7:00 = Meet and greet (eat Pizza!)
7:00 - 8:00 = Presentation and Demo 
8:00 - 8:30 = Q&A
results.name: Data-Driven Functional, Integration and End-to-End Testing in the API Economy

results.description:
Thank you to H. Glenn Grant, CEO & Chief Visionary, G2 Technology Group, and his awesome team, for hosting and presenting. Always an informative and fun event with G2!


The event's main topic? Technical Debt

WHY? A common challenge faced by technology driven businesses is "Tech Debt." In the race to get a product to market it’s typical to see sacrifices (and mistakes) made along the way that can cause significant challenges down the road as the business scales. This evening's presenters will be sharing their war stories and wins with regard to identifying, avoiding and paying down technical debt on AWS backed infrastructures.

3 Presentations...


Presentation: Paying Down Tech Debt in Mid-migration, the “Low Hanging Fruit”
Presenter: Glenn Grant - CEO & Chief Visionary, G2 Tech Group
Abstract: Migration projects are an excellent opportunity to pay down some tech debt and score big wins in the process. Glenn’s talk will focus on what tech debt is, how to spot it, and where it typically comes from. He’ll touch on some of the most common tech debt hurdles such as deprecated OS lock-in, home-grown software load balancers, “pets” vs “cattle,” and drifting database platforms. We’ll then discuss migration strategies to pay down this tech debt with AWS products and services that can provide quick wins for your team without major code re-writes.

Presentation: AWS Migration Tool Spotlight 
Presenter: Danielle Greshock - Manager, Solutions Architecture, Amazon Web Services
Abstract: Danielle will focus more deeply on some of the tools and services AWS provides to help customers migrate workloads. She will provide deeper technical insight on some of the solutions highlighted in Glenn’s presentation.

Presentation: Technical Debt and Systems Management
Presenter: Mick England – Director of Operations, True Fit Corporation
Abstract: This talk will examine the impact of technical debt upon cloud migration projects and how to address technical debt in infrastructure and systems management. It will include a discussion of what you can and should fix in the course of a cloud migration and how to future proof your cloud.

Contact Mark Annati, the moderator, at [masked] with interest in sponsoring (location/food) and presenting at upcoming meetups.
Thank you.

results.description:
Ever want to go an an adventure to the beautiful beaches and lush rain forests of Costa Rica? Well, here is your opportunity. We're planning an amazing trip with 5 different levels of accommodations and an amazing array of adventures at your fingertips at the most very affordable price.


Right now the projected dates for our group are November 26th to December 3rd, but other dates are available. (I might be going in July as well. But Stacey goes down often.) More to come for Jan/Feb 2017. Just come for general info now and you can figure out which dates are best for you later.


Whether you want to go on a budget and stay at an amazing surf hostel right on the volcanic black sand beaches, where you might witness sea turtles nesting, or to the other extreme, an all inclusive adult resort right on an exotic coast, we have it for you.

Each has it's pros and cons. It all depends on what you're looking for. But all are amazingly fun and you'll never forget this adventure. Guarantee it!!!!

And one thing you get on these that you won't get from any online booking site - and this is the best part.  A meetup organizer that has experience in the area to show you a good time. It's like having your own local tour guide-because you do!!!!

.......................................

Please look at our 5 options below:

Option 1 - Surf Hostel - Don't let the name fool you. This is Raw Costa Rican beauty at its best. Delicious food, gracious hosts, all RIGHT on the black sand beach of rural of the Central American Coast.

(That was me enjoying my morning tea at the hostel last December.)

Rustic, yet clean and comfortable, and right on the beach.

The food is amazing and the staff is super accommodating and sweet. Still close to all the attractions and adventures. The door to this room is about 25 feet from where I had my tea in the top photo. Gorgeous!

...................................................................................................

Option 2 - The Turtle Lodge. A step up. Very clean, upgraded accommodations in Ostional.  Very tranquil with AC and private baths.

...........................................................................

Option 3 - Azul Ocean Club 5 Star Resort

A luxury resort not far from the above places and attractions, with high end restaurants and accommodations. It's a 5 star, well-manicured resort, close to all the activities and and other venues so we can still play together.

...........................................................................

Option 4 - Surf House in Nosara. 

Nosara is a coastal surf community full of restaurants, night life, gorgeous beaches and Costa Rican activities such as surfing, zip lining, yoga, horseback riding and a whole lot more...The advantage to this gem is that you're right in the middle of all the action. You will be able to walk to many of the activities you're looking for. This house is not a definite. It depends on how many people sign up and how quickly. But why I am eager to get this  ball rolling. The quicker you guys sign up and pay the more likely it is that we land a nice house like this near the water.

..............................................................................

Option 5 - Adults Only - All Inclusive Occidental Grand Papagayo Resort -  Closer to the airport this all inclusive offers one stop shopping for those who want a short commute from the airport and a more relaxing time away. Costa Rican adventures are still a step away but this is for those of you who are looking for a less active and more "polished" vacation.

..............................................................................

ACTIVITIES

In addition to these resorts are our activities. Some will be included depending on your package. All can be added.

Sunset horseback riding on the beach

Yoga with a view

Stand Up Paddleboarding (or sitting...). Either way the view is amazing!

Surfing Lessons

View the wildlife.... Ever want to moon your friends in a rainforest waterfall?

Or Ziplining ...
results.how_to_find_us: Just Knock on the Door

results.description:
Question for Discussion:  Do most religions, including Humanism, largely ignore the suffering of people who are not co-religionists?

Three examples:
1.  Pope Pius XII did not publicly condemn the Holocaust during World War II. He did however save a number of Jews. Later, John Paul II acknowledged and apologized for past antisemitic behavior by the Catholic church. 

 2.  Many people fleeing Syria are dying in their quest, but Humanists say little about this.  “Children have the right to be free from religious coercion in their public schools,” said Roy Speckhardt, president of the American Humanist Association.  Why is religious coercion a greater concern than people dying at sea? 

3.  The majority of Jewish Israelis support actions to push Palestinian Arabs out of their land. They largely ignore the ethnic cleansing of Arab villages that happened in 1948 with the support of David Ben Gurion.

results.description:
Come to Orleans on Tuesday 5/10 and enjoy some fantastic beers from Boulevard Brewing! With the warm weather (hopefully!) here, be one of the first to try one of Boulevard's summer beers! Orleans will be cooking up derby themed specials, and The patio and windows will be open, letting in that sweet spring breeze, (pending weather approval) so RSVP today! http://boulevardtripeljulep.eventbrite.com/?aff=mu

Take a fantastic Belgian Tripel, age it in whiskey barrels, add some peppermint, and you'll get Boulevard's Tripel Julep. This fantastic beer will remind you of the classic derby cocktail, so give it a go!
Be one of the first to try the Tropical Pale Ale, a collaboration with Cigar City Brewing that will make you think you are on a beach somewhere. The beer starts with a soft pilsner base that has been generously hopped and then sliced grapefruit and passion-fruit is added. It's fantastic!
Make sure you try Boulevard's Ginger-Lemon Radler! Radlers are lighter beers and traditionally were lemonade mixed with beer. This one spices things up with a healthy dose of ginger and is super delicious!
Matt from Boulevard will be around to give out some amazing swag; delicious food will be served; and there will be lots of delicious beers flowing all evening long!

This event is free to attend, pay as you eat and drink!
results.name: Post-Derby Celebration! Tripel Julep, Tropical Pale Ale & Lemon-Ginger Radler!

results.description:
Amy Goodman discusses Democracy Now! … Twenty Years Covering the Movements Changing America – A Cambridge Forum

Tuesday, May 10th, 7pm

First Parish Church, 1446 Massachusetts Ave., Cambridge

This event is free; no tickets are required. Event link HERE. 

:: :: ::

Cambridge forum welcomes the host and executive producer of Democracy Now! AMY GOODMAN for a discusion of her book Democracy Now!: Twenty Years Covering the Movements Changing America.About Democracy Now!

In 1996 Amy Goodman began hosting a show on Pacifica Radio called Democracy Now! to focus on the issues and movements that are too often ignored by the corporate media. Today Democracy Now!is the largest public media collaboration in the US, broadcasting on over 1,400 public television and radio stations around the world, with millions accessing it online at DemocracyNow.org. Now Amy, along with her journalist brother, David, and co-author Denis Moynihan, share stories of the heroes—the whistleblowers, the organizers, the protesters—who have brought about remarkable change.

This important book looks back over the past two decades of Democracy Now! and the powerful movements and charismatic leaders who are re-shaping our world. Goodman takes the reader along as she goes to where the silence is, bringing out voices from the streets of Ferguson to Staten Island, Wall Street, South Carolina to East Timor—and other places where people are rising up to demand justice. Democracy Now! is the modern day underground railroad of information, bringing stories from the grassroots to a global audience. 

Learn more about this event at: http://www.cambridgeforum.org/

For nearly four decades, Cambridge Forum has provided free public forums for the discussion of the issues and ideas that are shaping our world. From culture to technology, the environment to public policy, Cambridge Forum offers citizens vital information about the challenges facing contemporary society.

Forum programs, which are edited and produced for subsequent broadcast on public radio stations nation-wide, feature the nation's most noted thinkers, creators, social entrepreneurs, and leaders from the worlds of academia, business, government, media and the arts. Programs are held at the First Parish Church located at 3 Church Street in Harvard Square with book sales provided by Harvard Book Store for book presentations. Learn more at cambridgeforum.org.

General Info: (617)[masked] - [masked] 

Media Inquiries: (617)[masked] x1 - [masked] 

Accessibility Inquiries: [masked]
results.name: Amy Goodman

results.description:
An evening of meditation practice, led by Rev. Kim K. Crawford Harvie, Senior Minister. Sessions include seated & walking meditation, Dharma talk, and conversation.  This practice is open to all, beginning and experience practitioners.


The warm, inviting evening includes two short seated meditations; walking meditation through the gorgeous Arlington Street Church sanctuary and Public Garden; and community discussion.


Rev. Kim K. Crawford Harvie is an extraordinary and inspired leader in the LGBTQ community.  She is founder of The Shared Heart, a traveling exhibition and book of photographs of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender teenagers, designed to support the Massachusetts Safe Schools Initiative.  The Legacy Foundation named Rev. Crawford Harvie Uncommon Woman of the Year.  The Women's Educational and Industrial Union of Boston honored her as one of 100 outstanding women in the Commonwealth.  She is recipient of the Maximilian Kolbe Award for Community Service and was named Provincetown Citizen of the Year.  In 2004, she performed the first same-sex wedding in a church in the United States.  

Rev. Kim has been a Zen Buddhist practitioner since 1977.

For more information on the evening:  Arlington Street Zen Center


Prior to the ASZC at 7:00 pm, you are also warmly invited to join the Buddha's Belly Book Group at 6:00 pm in the Hunnewell Chapel.  Check out the ASC website for information on what book the Buddhas Belly group is currently reading.

results.description:
In this 4 week hands-on workshop you will leverage the latest brain research and life coaching techniques to transform your life with intuitive mixed-media journaling. Use your whole brain to gain insight into relationships, career, and any other life issue by tapping into your own inner well of intuitive wisdom.

In order to register for the course please go to www.deborahhelen.com to pay after you RSVP here. Special 20% discount and bonus offers for PGN members. Regular price: $250 +$20 materials fee. PGN members pay $200 + $20 materials fee.


Who should come?


Do you want to improve your primary relationship? Are you unsure what to do about your current job situation? Do you want to apply the latest brain research on how we think to help you make better decisions? Are you ready to embrace your inner intuitive guide? If so, then the Intuitive MoJo 4 week workshop is for you. 


The problem with how we think

So many of us are unsure and afraid to make the big decisions, so we keep on doing the same thing, because even if we’re not happy, there is safety in familiarity.

Unfortunately, our current way of making decisions is flawed, and rarely are our decisions as rational as we would like to believe. When it comes to life choices, this can lead us away from our true path, away from happiness. 

Intuitive mixed-media journaling (or "Intuitive MoJo", for short) is designed to help you avoid common thinking mistakes by using your whole brain to make the best decision every time. Your inner guide is hidden in underdeveloped regions of your brain. 

What you'll learn in this 4 week hands-on workshop

• Why your rational "thinking" brain doesn't always get it right and how your "emotional brain" really calls the shots

• How to use pictures and images to access the wisdom of your emotional brain via the right brain hemisphere

• How journaling opens the pathways of communication between different regions of your brain

• How to use mixed-media journaling to access your own inner wisdom

Never again will you feel lost when faced with an important decision. You will have immediate access to wisdom and insights that are exactly right for you at this moment in time.  

How we will proceed

In this workshop we will use powerful questions from life coaching to guide our exploration of using Intuitive MoJo for insights into relationships, career and more. 

In a supportive group environment you will receive valuable and heart-centered feedback from one another.

Intuitive MoJo is grounded in the latest brain research but it’s also a lot of fun! 

Questions to think about

Remember a time when you had a big life decision to make and you weren't sure what to do? How did you go about making that decision? 

Have you ever made a bad life decision? How did you go about making that decision?

With Intuitive MoJo, you will use your brain differently to make better life decisions, whether about career, relationships, health or finance. And have fun while you're at it!

Our Presenter: Deborah Helen 

Deborah Helen, PhD, is an educator-turned-life coach who has studied brain research, cognitive psychology and developmental psychology with a focus on adult development and learning. She regularly engages in meditation, creative visualization and journaling and closely follows the literature on personal development. She is leaving a long career in K-12 and higher education to turn to her long-time passion for life coaching.

After developing the Intuitive MoJo process she began teaching it to small groups in her home with great success. She is currently writing a book about how Intuitive MoJo can help people make better decisions and transform their lives.  The book should be out by fall 2016.

Deb developed Intuitive MoJo when she realized that the popular "rational" approach to decision making simply didn't work for her. She started applying her knowledge of recent brain research to the idea of making better life decisions. Delighted with the results, she began sharing Intuitive MoJo with others.

Visit DeborahHelen.com to learn more about whole brain living. You will find information, exercises, tools and resources that will enable you to re-open the lines of communication with your inner guide. 

Sign up to receive a free guide to accessing your intuition and get notices for new events. A four-week Intuitive MoJo course will be opening in May, with an online course opening in the summer.

Here is what others have to say about Intuitive MoJo

"My experience with intuitive multimedia journaling was truly life changing. I had no idea what to expect when I went into this class, but it opened my eyes to a whole new way of looking at images and ultimately learning about myself and my life through journaling and creating collages." Alex B, marketing and communications 

"I absolutely loved the experience! Debbie helped you to center, offers little tips and tricks on how to tap your intuition and use your mind and heart to explore the ideas and images that come to you." Lana C, herbalist 

"When I think of Intuitive Mojo I have to call it Intuitive Mojo Creative Artistic Fun and Journaling because the class encompassed so much more than a few words alone could express. This was such a wonderful experience I didn't want it to end." Ann Z.

Brookline, MA
results.name: Deborah Helen: Intuitive MoJo (4 Week Workshop)

results.description:
Though we might wish we could, we can't always think of everything ourselves. Join Danny and other writers for a chance to engage your writing with a community and get the kind of new, original feedback that gets the writing juices flowing. Before every meeting we'll each submit a short story, section of a novel or other work to be reviewed (up to 10-12 double spaced pages or[masked] words*). Come prepared to give written and verbal feedback on others' work as well as receive feedback on your own. Open to all, but limited to 5 each session (plus organizers) on a first come first serve basis.

Please RSVP and be prepared to submit your work about a week before we meet to give everyone a chance to read. RSVPs will close a few days before the event.

Submissions are hosted on a shared Box.com folder, which requires an email address to access.  If this is your first time joining, let Danny know your preferred email address and he will invite you.

Monthly
Cost is $15

Led by Danny Shain

Danny graduated from Union College with a degree in English, and has spent years working as a copy-editor, freelance writer and blogger.  A follower of technology trends whose reading interests range from the fantastical to the contemporary to the philosophical, Danny is excited to help people refine their writing, express themselves, and build a writing community through this workshop.

*Note: If you'd like to include slightly more than 10-12 pages to provide some context (ie: your chapter ends 1-2 pages later) that's ok, but please indicate which pages you'd like critiqued. Pages beyond that should be submitted as an optional read.

Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
Rojava is an area about the size of Connecticut in the Kurdish land along the Turkish and Syrian border. The women and men there are building an egalitarian society based at least in part on the writings of the late Murray Bookchin, a U.S. Anarchist. They are fighting against Isis and also against capitalist nations who oppose what they are doing. Their goal is not to establish a separate nation for the Kurds, but to build a grass-roots society of neighborhoods and communities that practice real egalitarianism including between the sexes (which is especially remarkable in that part of the world). For example, all major offices in Rojava are held by two individuals, one male and one female.


You can search on line for "Rojava" and several links will come up, including one to an article that appeared in the New York TImes Magazine last November. I recommend that you explore these to get some background information, which will enrich our discussion; but if you don't, that's fine and you are still welcome to come and participate!


We were very fortunate at our April meetup to have a speaker with first-hand knowledge of current events in Rojava: Jonas Linde, a Swedish man who works with the Swedish Rojava Groups.

We listened to what Jonas had to say and asked questions, made comments, and engage in a livelydiscussion.

At our next meetup, on May 3, we will continue the discussion about Rojava!
results.name: Let's discuss what we learned last month about Rojava and move forward.

This free online training walks you through each step, solving the problem of what to do next, and what NOT to do. Armed with the knowledge given, you can confidently make wise investment decisions!

Free Online Training Date/Time:

Tuesday, May 10th at 8:00pm (Eastern Time)

Learn How to Research Vital Information about any Property

All of the information you need about any property is right at your fingertips. Physical Property Characteristics such as bedrooms, baths, square footage, lot size, build date, Tax Info, Sale Dates, Mortgage Amounts, Lien Holders, Loan types, and much more.

Learn How to Run Real Comparable Sales

Comparable Sales that show Actual Sold Amounts (Not Estimated Values) Addresses, Subdivisions, Bedrooms, Baths, Square Footage, Year Built, Distance from Property and Averaged Cost Per Square Foot. Quickly Determine the After Repaired Value and Print a Comparable Sales Report.

Learn How to Contact Owners Faster

Unparalleled People Finder and Phone Search Capability lets you research the owners name, possible family member names, approximate age, deceased status and phone numbers including real time cell phone numbers. 

You’ll be miles ahead of the competition when you have direct access to the owner, and REIPro’s comprehensive cache of phone scripts, property owner questions and a direct mail marketing system is at your fingertips to help you get the results you need more efficiently.

Learn How to Make Multiple Types of Offers

For the first time ever, you’ll be able to make multiple types of offers right inside REIPro. Give sellers more options... from paying cash or structuring a creative financing offer to maximize your profit potential, making multiple offers is the secret weapon to building wealth in real estate. 

Free Online training that teaches you how to find the deals to closing them. Register now because we expect this class to fill up quickly.


Free Online Training Date/Time:

Tuesday, May 10th at 8:00pm (Eastern Time)

Click Here to Register for this FREE Online Training >>>

Chris Goff

results.description:
We are meeting every Tuesday night from 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM practicing Modern Arnis, WC, and SCJ flow drills and Self-Defense skills.

All levels are welcome!  For ages 15 and up.


The price is $15.00 /per person /per meetup. The first meetup is free.

Please wear loose fitting, comfortable cloths suitable for working out.

Please do not wear shoes that you've worn outdoors on the wood floor.



Instructor's Background

Alix Lavaud has been training Martial Arts for over 45 years and is a master of Modern Arnis, Pien San Wing Chun Kung Fu, and has extensive training in Small Circle Jujitsu.  He also humbly owns the rank of Lakan Apat (a 4th degree BLACKBELT ).


Lineage

Modern Arnis :  Remy Presas  -->  Alix Lavaud

Wing Chun:  Henry Mui  -->  Alix Lavaud

Small Circle Jujitsu:  Wally Jay -->  Alix Lavaud


Philosophy

 Go With The Flow ...

Some Quotes we Love

“If your mind is empty, it is ready for anything. In the beginner’s mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert’s there are few”
― Shunryu Suzuki


“Everything is perfect and there is always room for improvement.”
― Shunryu Suzuki

“We must exist right here and right now!”
― Shunryu Suzuki

Benefits of Martial Arts

1.  Mental Benefits

2.  Improved Balance

3.  Improved Flexibility

4.  Focus and stillness

5.  Hand and Eye Coordination

6.  Improved reflexes

7.  Learn self-defense skills

8.  Stress relief

9.  Relax

10.  Gain Self Confident and Self Respect

11.  Learn to Breathe

12.  Learn to Find Focus and Stillness

13.  Encouraging Non-Violent Conflict Resolution

14.  Improvement in many other Areas of Life

results.description:
This presentation will introduce usage of Apache Apex for Time Series & Data Ingestion Service by General Electric Internet of things Predix platform. Apache Apex is a native Hadoop data in motion platform that is being used by customers for both streaming as well as batch processing. Common use cases include ingestion into Hadoop, streaming analytics, ETL, database off-loads, alerts and monitoring, machine model scoring, etc.

Agenda: 

9:30pm - Predix overview and usage of Apache Apex 

10:15pm - Demo 

10:45pm - Q&A 

Abstract: Predix is an General Electric platform for Internet of Things. It helps users develop applications that connect industrial machines with people through data and analytics for better business outcomes. Predix offers a catalog of services that provide core capabilities required by industrial internet applications. We will deep dive into Predix Time Series and Data Ingestion services leveraging fast, scalable, highly performant, and fault tolerant capabilities of Apache Apex. 

Speakers: 

- Venkatesh Sivasubramanian, Sr Staff Software Engineer, GE Predix & Committer of Apache Apex 

- Pramod Immaneni, PPMC member of Apache Apex, and DataTorrent Architect 

Please register for General Electric - Internet of Things Predix Time Series & Data Ingestion Service using Apache Apex (Hadoop) on May 10, 2016 at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/6272571274088007940

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

@ApacheApex, meetup presentations, meetup recordings, download, Apache Apex releases, docs

results.description: We will meet in Chinatown,  where a Chinese woman who came to the US to attend college and has lived in Boston for the last three years, and spent a year working in Chinatown,  will take us on a tour of this neighborhood.  Our guide is not a professional tour guide, but will offer her own perspective on Chinatown.  Following the 1.5-2 hour walking tour, our guide will join us for lunch and we can benefit from her knowledge of Chinese food in the area!  We need to limit the size of the group to ten due to the small size of many of the Chinatown shops/businesses.  If there is enough interest, we will repeat this meetup so that all who want to can participate.  If you do not get in to this one, but you are interested in a future tour, please comment below.  The $15/person charge to sign up of for the meetup is to cover the cost of the tour guide.   Each person will pay for their own lunch at the restaurant (to be determined...)  Please bring cash to pay for your lunch.    Note that this tour is planned as an alternative to a much more expensive professional tour that is available in Boston.   I felt that this would be a great alternative and just as much fun!  Remember, no refunds as we will need to pay the tour guide whether or not you are able to attend.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Wednesday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill 
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street 
Mission Hill, Roxbury 
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops) 
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer, 
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"! 
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2). 

Some arrive as early as 3:30 pm (you don't NEED to do that, but you're welcome to do so; OUR meetup's attendees - it's posted on 6 meetups - are often there early, and you can chat).


We (MOST of us) arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm or so (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Use the T - #66 bus comes by - E-Line or Orange Line

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share' 
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort.
TALK with us FIRST !!
Looking for Gifted Marketers to
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas

What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag?

Portion Control

Bake...Don't Fry!

Roasted Veggie Stackers

No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream

Avocados!!!

Salad with Chipotle Hummus

Simple Cilantro Chutney

More $2 bags of Produce!

Drink your greens!

Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"!
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).


We arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

results.description:
You may not know it, but the original parcel of land that founded the Audobon Society is not even one block off Beacon Street, right where Brookline and Boston meet. That piece of land is kept wild and free, and even though it’s small, you can find a bountiful variety of birds there – and wild medicinal plants!

The ability to identify and use plants was once commonplace to every man, woman, and child, but today most of us have lost that knowledge. Come reclaim what’s yours!

Join us regularly throughout the growing seasons and learn the plants in all of their stages of growth. By the end of these sessions, you’ll feel confident in your ability to identify the many medicinal plants growing right in the middle of the city – and you’ll learn how you can work with them!

Wednesday, May 11th, 2016
5:30 – 6:30pm
Hall’s Pond Sanctuary, Brookline MA 02446

Meet at the gate near the tennis courts, just off Beacon Street near the Hawes Street T stop. We’ll get started right at 5:30 and wrap up by 6:30. Feel free to bring a notebook or sketchbook, cameras, etc. The fee for the herb walk is $5.

Herb walks are “Sprinkle or Shine!” – if it’s just damp or a bit drizzly, we’ll walk anyway. If it’s raining enough to need an umbrella, that makes it hard to learn, so we will cancel in that event.

Interested in having us come and do an herb walk somewhere in particular? Let us know!

http://commonwealthherbs.com/halls-pond-herb-walk-brookline/
results.name: Hall's Pond Herb Walk, Brookline

results.description:
Have you ever found yourself wanting to do something and yet struggling to find the motivation? In this workshop we'll practice two useful techniques for turning ambivalence into action: goal factoring and aversion factoring. The basic idea is to break up goals and aversions into simple parts, divide, and conquer. Come join us at Joco's on Wednesday to learn more!

You may get more out of this workshop if you identify in advance a task or general goal that you've been struggling with.

Our usual schedule is 


• 5:30-6pm Welcome everyone and discuss progress  on goals from last week. Order drinks and appetizers or dinner. 


• 6-7:00pm Focused discussion and work on our topic for the week. In addition to discussion of the theory, we really want to do exercises and make progress on real problems.


• 7-7:30pm Conclude and set individual goals for next meeting 


• 7:30-... Chat, mingle and leave whenever

Please bring something to write with and on.
results.how_to_find_us: We usually reserve a table in the back left. It should be easy to find.
results.name: Wednesday Workshop: Goal and Aversion Factoring

results.description:
"A user story is a tool used in Agile software development to capture a description of a software feature from an end-user perspective. The user story describes the type of user, what they want and why. A user story helps to create a simplified description of a requirement."

User stories are a great way to manage requirements in software development. When written correctly, they are small, light, to the point and make the benefit of any requirement explicit. Getting them right takes some time and practice. Most of the issues with gathering requirements in agile software development and agile testing derive from issues with User Stories.

Join us and learn about the best practices to write better User Stories. 

Speakers:

• Lisa Jarek

Product Manager, Monster Inc.

• Jared Menke

Sr. Software Development Manager, Engineering, Kronos Inc

• Bob Fischer

Regional Agile Delivery Leader/Agile Coach, Eliassen Group

Key takeaways for attendees:

• Effective trends in the Agile world, and key skills for Product Owners to write effective user stories

• The key elements of an effective user story

• What is working in the industry, how these trends will impact the skill sets and experiences required for future product owner job

• Common mistakes to avoid

A variety of delicious hot and cold appetizers will be served.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for "Think Agile" Meetup Group at Reception
results.name: Writing Effective User Stories

Fulfill your dreams and impress your family and friends by building your own graphical app and deploying it to the entire world with WebGL! The premiere graphics standard for the internet now allows you to harness the awesome power of the GPU without administrator privileges, so even the most casual user can bask in your shading glory. 

Details:


Join us in CIC's beautiful Charles Conference Room overlooking the river. We can work through the tutorials at learningwebgl.com or focus on any topic you choose. Bring a laptop and a project you're stuck on or need a little extra help with - our team of GL experts will be here and ready to assist with the finer points of graphics programming.


The only software you'll need is a browser, and you already have that installed. You're ready to go! By the end of the meetup, you will have made something beautiful. Then we'll all go to Firebrand Saints downstairs for a drink.

Cost:

Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Hi everyone,


At our May meeting, you'll learning about user stories and testable requirements. Also, we still are looking for volunteers to step up and consider running for our board of directors...


Topic: How to Transform User Stories into Coherent Testable Requirements

Speaker:  Malcolm Stiefel

Because user stories are so brief, it may be difficult for developers to determine how to test and how to ensure that the user stories are complete.  We will discuss a method for addressing these challenges, creating testable functional requirements from user stories and using state information to help ensure that requirements are complete.

Attendees will learn:

·  How to transform user stories into use cases

·  How to leverage an inherently testable model of functional requirements

·  How to work with the product owner to confirm the requirements

·  How to use state information to establish relationships among use cases and ensure completeness of a set of functional requirements

Speaker Bio:

Mal Stiefel, an independent consultant since 1994, has more than 40 years of systems and software engineering experience in military, civilian government, and commercial applications, with expertise in requirements definition, testing, database management, geospatial information systems, training, simulation, process improvement, quality assurance, configuration management, and project management.  He has developed and taught courses addressing agile development methods for clients such as Fidelity Investments, EMC, and Royal Bank of Scotland. He earned the Certified Software Quality Engineer designation from the American Society for Quality in 1996.  He has a B.S.E.E. from the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn.
results.name: SQGNE May Meeting - How to Turn User Stories into Testable Requirements

group.name: Software Quality Group of New England

results.description:
By far the most important SQL Server release since the heady days of 2005, SQL Server 2016 represents a huge leap forward in a number of key areas. You've no doubt heard plenty about such features as Query Store, JSON support, Polybase, and the other big-ticket items. But there are also a number of very cool features that don't usually make the top 10 lists. In this talk you'll learn about enhancements to indexing (including both Columnstore and traditional b-tree indexes), DMVs, compression, string handling, encryption, configuration, and even timezone support. These smaller features may not be highlighted in the latest glossy ads from Microsoft's marketing department, but they're the kinds of things that add up to make your life easier. Attend this session to learn all sorts of new and different reasons to upgrade as quickly as possible.

Adam Machanic (@AdamMachanic) is a Boston-based SQL Server developer, writer, and speaker. He focuses on large-scale data warehouse performance and development, and is author of the award-winning SQL Server monitoring stored procedure, sp_WhoIsActive. Adam has written for numerous web sites and magazines, including SQLblog, Simple Talk, Search SQL Server, SQL Server Professional, CoDe, and VSJ. He has also contributed to several books on SQL Server, including "T-SQL Querying" (Microsoft Press, 2015) and "SQL Server 2008 Internals" (Microsoft Press, 2009). Adam regularly speaks at conferences and training events on a variety of SQL Server topics. He is a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) for SQL Server, a Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP), and an alumnus of the INETA North American Speakers Bureau.
results.name: SQL Server 2016 "Hidden Gems" - Adam Machanic

group.name: New England SQL Server User Group

results.description:
In this class we will be learning how to use Onshape, a free, professional 3D modeling program used by engineers and designers in industry. Onshape is a type of parametric CAD, which is quite different than tools like SketchUp and TinkerCAD and is more similar to tools used in industry. Because it is free, easily accessible, and requires no installation, it is a great introduction into the world of professional design. We will start with the basics of 3D modeling and work our way up to more advanced modeling techniques. In addition, we will explore tools unique to Onshape, including simultaneously collaborating on a single part, version control, and best practices for managing CAD data on the cloud. For anyone interested in hardware startups or those familiar with traditional CAD but not with full-cloud CAD, join us!

This event is for adults and kids 16 and up. Please bring your laptop and sign up for Onshape before coming https://www.onshape.com/

This session will be in the Innovation Space directly across the hall from HATCH.

REGISTRATION IS NOW OPEN for the spring season of the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League! This year we’re pleased to announce an expanded offering of locations. 

Site Locations, Match Times and Starting Dates:

South Boston, MA @Joe Moakley Park: Wednesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 11th) 

South Boston, MA @ Joe Moakley Park: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th) 

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Wednesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 11th)

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th)

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Tuesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 10th) 

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th) 

League Format:

The format for the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League will be the same as last year – 7 weeks, 6 teams, 1-hour long matches, and restaurant specials after on-court play. Our first week will be a tennis jamboree open to everyone, weeks 2-6 will be round-robin team competition, week 7 will be an individual tournament unless utilized for rained-out match makeups.

Boston Traders' Meetup

You are invited to attend the monthly Boston Traders' Meetup meetings.

This time we will be talking about evaluation of portfolio performance, performance metrics, and global investment performance standards.

Any new members will have the chance to introduce themselves state the market that he or she trades and perhaps a very brief description of the approach taken. For example, an introduction could be, "Hi, my name is Fred Hampton and I trade forex breakouts during the London session."

From there, the floor is open for people to discuss anything about trading. You may talk about something you learned recently about trading or about an obstacle that you are facing in trading or make a request for resources from other members.

Please print out and bring this BostonTradersMeetup sign so you can connect with the other members easily.
www.meetup.com/BostonTraders/files/

Part of the purpose of this group is for people to connect with other traders so it's encouraged for people to exchange contact info. For example, if you are an options trader and another options trader talks about a topic that interests you, then feel free to ask the person if she or he would like to exchange contact info.

-------------------- 

This meeting is FREE and it repeats on the 2nd Wednesday of every month.

results.description:
Join us for a speaker night focused on what we too often consider a negligible edge case of internet-driven digital experiences!


--

We live in a disconnected & battery powered world, but our technology and best practices are a leftover from the always connected & steadily powered past.

Offline capability is a key characteristic of modern Progressive Web Applications. Offline first thinking must learn from and further what we’ve seen work with Responsive and Mobile First thinking.

Read the introduction and the follow up on A List Apart.

(introduction copied from offlinefirst.org)

--

Agenda

- 6:00pm: [food] Grab a bite to eat, get settled in, meet your neighbors!

- 6:20pm: [talk] How to Uncover Hidden Assumptions


- 6:50pm: [talk] Designing for Offline Experiences

- 7:20pm: [talk] The Joi of Offline First UX

- 7:40-8pm: Open forum

--

How to Uncover Hidden Assumptions
by Maria Matveeva | @rgbcolor

A difference in expectations is one of the most preventable causes of projects going wrong. And among all expectations, assumptions can be the most dangerous. They feel so “obvious” that no one even bothers to bring them up. But when collaborators act on conflicting assumptions, it’s only a matter of time until problems arise.

The skill of finding and addressing hidden assumptions is necessary to prevent nasty surprises down the line - and to keep client and team relationships productive in the long term. Attendees will walk away with a roadmap to dealing with assumptions in UX Design projects, as well as specific techniques and example questions they can use in almost any situation.

Designing for Offline Experiences
by Steven Trevathan | @strevat

Devices are orbiting internet connectivity at all times, like cars passing under the glow of street lamps, only without their own light to follow. Our practice in designing modern web applications is burdened by a past that assumed the browser was for reading one document at a time on a steadily connected device.

In this talk, Steve will introduce the audience to the challenges of creating offline experiences, share offline design patterns found in the wild, describe process we may use to discover the unique cases of our own offline experiences, and shed some light on the state of worldwide device connectivity.

The Joy of Offline First UX
by Gregor Martynus | @gr2m

Offline First bring unprecedented possibilities for great user experiences. Imagine a world without `sign up` and `save` buttons, with local encryption and selective data sync, and benefiting from seamless transitions between connective states.

In this talk, Gregor will share experiences from running minutes.io, a 5+ years old Offline First web application.


--
results.name: Designing "Offline First" Applications

We had quite a tradition last year, of walking amongst the (sometimes surprising) nature at Horn Pond. Everyone walks at their own pace. Optional short trek up Mt. Tawanda, or break on through to the other side. Good exercise, but lots of wandering, chatting, laughing and wondering at the swans, geese, ducks, turtles, herons, and more!  We've seen all kinds of nesting waterfowl, spring babies, snapping turtles, rabbits, and other common creatures.  Some gorgeous sunsets as we're leaving. I fed the swans, ducks, and a mistake, the geese. They had chased me pecking, and they can haul. ps. the swan couple come back every year, and typically have around eight cygnets, nice Joan. Nature, and Darwinism  reigns, and about two, to four live to spread their wings. Beware of the snappers!

results.description:
Price: $130.00 per person (no refunds)

       • once the majority of rsvp's has been reached, I'll send out an email as to where to send your check

       • payment is due immediately

What: Golf Lessons - 6 Wednesdays

When: Wednesday, May 11, 2016 @ 6:30 PM (instruction will begin promptly @ 6:30 so please arrive a few minutes early)

Cost: $130.00 per person (5 wkly lessons & wk 6 live play)-unbelievable price!!

Who: No Guests for this meet-up as demand is high and space is limited

Hello Everyone -

It's Golf Season once again!   Guess what?  I've changed the day to Wednesday instead of Tuesdays considering in the past it seems to always rain on our Tuesday lessons.  Hopefully this will work out better for all of us.

Our first 4 lessons will be held at Harmon Golf Course, a private course, weeks 5 & 6 we will play at Strawberry Valley in Abington.  Week #5 the instructors will take us out on the course and critique our playing.  The final week, we all go out and play 9 holes or however many we can get through before dark.  In past years this has proven to be a great training clinic with wonderful professional instruction.

If you're new to the lessons this year - great! If you're joining us again - even better! Everyone is Welcome!!!  We max out participation in record time so please - be sure you can commit to the 6 week period with payment before RSVP'ing.  That way others are not shut out - THERE ARE NO REFUNDS - thank you for your consideration.

Thanks everyone.  Hope to see you all on the course!!!

Susan

======================================================

DETAILS:

The lessons will be with 3 Veteran Golf Pros.  We will have these dedicated Golf Pro's instruct us whereby the group will be split into skill levels and instructed accordingly.  Each week we'll rotate between instructors with instruction from each at a Beginner to Intermediate level.

Tentative Lesson Plan:

Week #1 - Putting, Chipping, Grip

Week #2 - Pitching, short game

Week #3 - Working with Irons

Week #4 - Woods, driving, T off

Week #5 - Live play on the course with instruction @ Strawberry Valley Golf Course, Abington

Week #6 - Live play 9 holes with group  (greens fees included)@ Strawberry Valley Golf Course, Abington

PAYMENT:

In order to be included you must commit to the 6 weeks.  There are NO refunds and payment is expected up front.  Once we have our group and the RSVP list is maxed out, I will email everyone as to the payment information.

NOTE:

If you RSVP to the clinic you are committing to the entire 6 weeks of classes or $130.00

If you have an absence during the clinic, unfortunately, I cannot refund for the week missed but that is ok

Plan to arrive a few minutes early each week to get organized and into groups as the lesson will begin promptly at 6:30 pm

Golf clubs and balls will be supplied to any member if needed at no charge.  If you do need to borrow clubs, please let me know if you'll need left or right handed clubs with your RSVP in the comment section.

SSFMG and its organizers are not responsible for any injuries to participants or damage to equipment.

WEATHER:

I will notify everyone via email of any cancellation due to inclement weather.  The golf course will not know of any cancellations.  You should expect an email that afternoon or the night before from me. Be sure to check your email if the weather seems questionable. However, we cannot control Mother Nature so I will do my best to notify everyone within 2 hours prior to the event. Please do not assume a cancellation unless you receive an email from me.

SALSA LEVEL 2: 7:30PM-8:30PM 
SALSA LEVEL 3: 8:30PM-9:30PM

Please arrive 15 minutes prior to class to sign up. We would like to try and start the class on time.

HOW MUCH?

$70 FOR 6 WEEK SESSION 
$17 DROP IN(1 CLASS)​​​

* Drop ins will only be allowed on the first day of each session for level 1 or 2.  Level 3 or above you can do drop in at any time. The reason for this is we want to make sure the students who attend the sessions from the beginning are not held up by potential students who miss the lesson from the previous classes.*


You wonder what level is the most appropriate for you? If you struggle with staying on beat/rhythm,you know very little about combination, musicality, or this is a new experience for you I will highly suggest level 1. Level 2 you will learn more difficult turn patterns and footwork but if you are not ready for level 2 you will be kindly asked to drop down to level 1. Dancing Salsa is a very fun yet dangerous dance. Safety is number 1 and we want to make sure everybody is executing proper techniques so that every dance/song you take part of you are dancing as smoothly and safe as possible. Level 3 class is TBD for June.

All payments will be made upon your arrival at the first class. Expect to pay the full $70 dollars at your first class if you choose to do the 6 week session. CASH OR CHECK OR CREDIT CARDS.

results.description:
Please support our host restaurant! Bar Lola has delicious drinks and tapas. Order at the bar and then join us in the back room.

"Celeste Price is an eighth-grade English teacher in suburban Tampa. She's undeniably attractive. She drives a red Corvette with tinted windows. Her husband, Ford, is rich, square-jawed, and devoted to her.

But Celeste's devotion lies elsewhere. She has a singular sexual obsession—fourteen-year-old boys. Celeste pursues her craving with sociopathic meticulousness and forethought; her sole purpose in becoming a teacher is to fulfill her passion and provide her access to her compulsion. As the novel opens, fall semester at Jefferson Jr. High is beginning.

In mere weeks, Celeste has chosen and lured the lusciously naive Jack Patrick into her web. Jack is enthralled and in awe of his teacher, and, most important, willing to accept Celeste's terms for a secret relationship—car rides after school; rendezvous at Jack's house while his single father works late; body-slamming encounters in Celeste's empty classroom between periods.

Ever mindful of the danger—the perpetual risk of exposure, Jack's father's own attraction to her, and the ticking clock as Jack leaves innocent boyhood behind—the hyperbolically insatiable Celeste bypasses each hurdle with swift thinking and shameless determination, even when the solutions involve greater misdeeds than the affair itself. In slaking her sexual thirst, Celeste Price is remorseless and deviously free of hesitation, a monstress driven by pure motivation. She deceives everyone, and cares nothing for anyone or anything but her own pleasure.


With crackling, rampantly unadulterated prose, Tampa is a grand, uncompromising, seriocomic examination of want and a scorching literary debut."

via goodreads

Please support our host restaurant! Bar Lola has delicious drinks and tapas. Order at the bar and then join us in the back room.
results.name: Boston Readers - Tampa by Alissa Nutting

SALSA LEVEL 1: 6:30PM-7:30PM 
SALSA LEVEL 2: 7:30PM-8:30PM 
SALSA LEVEL 3: 8:30PM-9:30PM

Please arrive 15 minutes prior to class to sign up. We would like to try and start the class on time.

HOW MUCH?

$70 FOR 6 WEEK SESSION 
$17 DROP IN(1 CLASS)​​​

* Drop ins will only be allowed on the first day of each session for level 1 or 2.  Level 3 or above you can do drop in at any time. The reason for this is we want to make sure the students who attend the sessions from the beginning are not held up by potential students who miss the lesson from the previous classes.*


You wonder what level is the most appropriate for you? If you struggle with staying on beat/rhythm,you know very little about combination, musicality, or this is a new experience for you I will highly suggest level 1. Level 2 you will learn more difficult turn patterns and footwork but if you are not ready for level 2 you will be kindly asked to drop down to level 1. Dancing Salsa is a very fun yet dangerous dance. Safety is number 1 and we want to make sure everybody is executing proper techniques so that every dance/song you take part of you are dancing as smoothly and safe as possible. Level 3 class is TBD for June.

All payments will be made upon your arrival at the first class. Expect to pay the full $70 dollars at your first class if you choose to do the 6 week session. CASH OR CHECK OR CREDIT CARDS.

You do not have to be a member of meetup to attend these lessons. Make sure you brings your friends with you!

For more info on Black Mamba Dance Company please check out blackmambasalsa.com or www.facebook.com/blackmambasalsa

results.description:
Hi Folks

If you want to hone your Android programming skills to an intermediate level and you completed the Udacity Android Programming for Beginners or have object oriented programming experience you should join us at Zipcar on Weds May[masked] at 6:30PM.
35 Thompson Place
Boston MA 02210.
Nearest T stop is Silver Line Courthouse (about 3 minute walk) or Red Line South Station (about 10 minute brisk walk). 

We are going to need everyone's full name ahead of time. We will be meeting on the first floor in the cafe, right off the entrance, but people will need to check in with security.

We'll meet every Wednesday to learn together for the next 9 or 10 weeks to learn Android using the Udacity Android Fundamentals free course. Zipcar has generously agreed to sponsor the venue and refreshments for this free community produced course.

This hands on course will cover wide ranging topics that will help you build complex apps with compelling layouts. It's taught using the Android Studio IDE. Please check the minimum system requirements to see if your machine matches. Why a study group? Less than 12% of the people who start an online course by themselves finish it. We’ve seen over 50% of the people who signed up for an online course who were committed to a study group complete the course. And, the developers who complete the course will receive a Google Developer Group Certificate of Completion.

Here’s what to expect:

At the Signup evening on Weds May 11 at Zipcar we'll introduce the Study Jam. We’ll review the course syllabus, what’s expected of you and what you need to do to succeed.Registration will open at the end of the meeting. Beginning on Wednesday evening May 25th and continuing for about 8 weeks we will meet at Zipcar to review our work together as a group. These weekly sessions will be led by experienced Android developers. The format will begin with a review followed by Q&A and student's discussions about their work. Each study group session will last one and a half to two hours. Some food will be served so you don’t have to stop on your way from work.

It will be great to see you there.
results.name: Weds 5/11 Level-up your programming skills to Intermediate Android free

results.description:
Come join us for a midweek climb!


To the left there is a chip-in feature. Your donations will go directly to the monthly dues and will allow MAC meetup group to keep going. Any amount would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

All levels are welcome! If you are new to climbing, there is a belay class at 7 PM. Here is the link to sign up: www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown 

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

The price is as follows:

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

Belay test: Free

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~

results.description:
- RSVP now for Wed, May 11 -

- Why you should ditch your elevator speech (if you even have one)

                                   ........................

We're planning another special meetup Wednesday, June 8, with verbal branding expert Stephen Melanson.

Let's face it: crafting an elevator speech - a clear, brief message that creates interest in a project, idea or in yourself (who you are, and what you're looking for) - is one tough assignment. Which explains why most of us avoid developing one. They're typically about 30 seconds, which approximates a typical attention span. Or does it?

Finally, here's a reason to throw away your elevator pitch (if you even have one).

Melanson believes they're too long, they provide description [vs position against the competition], and it's not a strategy to continue thru the rest of the conversation. “Branding books don’t recognize that the most important branding moments are conversations,”  he explains.

What's the answer?  Great verbal branding is direct, honest, and moves action. We'll learn how to intrigue our listener instead of losing their attention. Ever have that sinking feeling of watching your words fly past him/her?

Stephen Melanson is an entertaining and dynamic speaker. We'll start working on our personal branding statements in the previous meetup (May 25), and refine and revise them with Melanson at the special June 8 session.  The lessons you learn will stick with you for a long time to come.

                                                ........................

Our Regular Wed, May 11 Meetup:

If you're new to Speak Up Cambridge, what should you expect from our usual meetups?

Learn valuable do's and don'ts for addressing an audience. Listen to first-time speakers. And discover how to get over that "anxiety hurdle."

Did you ever imagine speaking to a group could be fun?

First-time (and returning) guests enjoy our simple exercises and learn useful techniques for connecting with an audience.

Our meet-ups are fast-paced and entertaining. Nobody feels intimidated. Come experience it for yourself: You'll get to listen to prepared speeches and learn simple yet effective speaking tips.

You are welcome to participate in our two-minute impromptu speaking exercises, but certainly not required. We do have a 30-second “Round Robin” that everyone participates in (it’s fun and easy), and you’ll probably be asked to introduce yourself [talk very briefly about an interest, or what brought you there]. Pretty basic, no surprises.  The only requirement is to enjoy yourself and get a sense of how the meet-ups run. [They start promptly at 6:50, so please arrive by or before 6:45. They end by 8:30 pm.]


Mark Your Calendar - Our Next Meet-Ups:

Wed, May 11 (6:45 PM)

Wed, May 25 (6:45 PM)

[Next "Second Saturday" AM session May 14.]

       ..............................

3rd Floor, Room 097.

You must take the elevator by the security desk to access the floor.

Parking: If you can't find street parking (Beware - Metered until 8 PM !), There is parking to the rear of the bldg. You will present ticket to the security desk on your way out ($3), then insert the ticket at the gate as you exit.
(Don't park in the supermarket/Porter Square shopping center parking lot.)


See the "About Us" tab for more info.

results.description:
Welcome to the Cash Game Summit, where the blinds are .25/.50 and the game is dealer's choice or no limit holdem. There is no minimum buyin and the max is 400 bb ($200.) There is no rake, tipping, donation, or seat fee. House rules are posted below:

If it's your first time at one of my games RSVP on meetup then text, email, or call to confirm your RSVP and receive the address. If you RSVP and no-show without changing your RSVP, then you have likely taken a seat from someone else, made me very sad, and I put your name on the shit list. Don't do it. If you're running late I appreciate hearing from you. Doors open at 6:35, and if you haven't arrived or contacted me about running late by 7:00, I will begin offering seats to the waitlist. I reserve the right to cancel the game if we can't get enough players.


-1 chip=call

-Players must protect their hands at all times. If your hand is unintentionally mucked because you didn't protect it, there is no recourse, and the hand is dead. No exceptions.

-Verbally declared actions are binding. Tapping the table is considered a check. An unintentional action will be forgiven only once/night. Rules must be enforced fairly with all players, regardless of experience level. No exceptions.

-No string bets or splashed pots.

-Don't discuss hands as they are ongoing. Talking about hands or action is allowed only are when heads up, and only by the 2 players remaining in the pot.

-Hands must remain on table or not more than 12 inches from the edge of the table and must be visible to all players.

-Everyone makes mistakes but strive to pay attention so you act in turn in a timely fashion. If you have trouble knowing when it's your turn, let me know, and I'll help you with a reminder.

-If you are in a hand or on the button (dealing), you are not allowed to be on your phone. -Host's decisions on rulings are final.

-Once a player is done dealing, s/he must move the button to the next dealer.

-Cut-off shuffles, then passes the shuffled deck to the small blind to be ready for next deal.

-Rule violations that influence the course of a hand will be dealt with as follows: First time=warning, Second time=dealt out for next hand. Third time=dealt out for a round. Again, everyone makes mistakes, but an awareness of the game is important. If you have questions about proper poker etiquette, you are always welcome to ask.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field. Open to all levels of players. Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.
