Join us at the Trident to welcome Dr. Mary Baures for a book signing, presentation, and discussion of her new book, Love Heals Baby Elephants – Rebirthing Ivory Orphans.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2BpAm-hN3fY

About the Book: Dr. Baures adopted four baby elephants who watched their families massacred for ivory. They were traumatized and cowered in fear. Gradually, through love and connection, they learned to trust again. They bloomed surefooted and joyous. Their story teaches us resilience and how to come back after we have lost everything

Mary Baures is also the author of Undaunted Spirits – Portraits of Recovery from Trauma and coproducer of Strong at the Broken Places – Turning Trauma into Recovery.

The venue has a full bar and restaurant so you can enjoy some food or drink while you listen.

results.description:
You don’t want to get laid.
You want to have mind blowing sex, be broken open and stretched at the edge of your capacity for love, pleasure and the divine.

You don’t want a relationship.
You want a soul mate (or many), not a romanticized cliché, but rather someone that challenges you to be a better version of yourself. A partner who is willing to open deeply, reveal themselves and really KNOW you. Someone that encourages your uniqueness and remembers who you really are even when you can’t.

You want it all!

In this interactive workshop, come learn a new way to approach relationships of all kinds (partners, lovers, friends with benefits, dating) that helps consciously take your relationships and sexual experiences to the next level. Using The Four Forces Framework...


You will learn:

·  The Four Forces that Create an “All-in” Relationships & Sex  -- And How You can Use Them

·  How to “Map” Desires and Both Get What you Want (& Why Compromise Doesn’t Work)

·  The 3 Essentials Skills to Creating Conscious Relationship and Loverships

·  How to use your Relationships for Growth and Evolution

·  How to Fall in Love with Anyone – And Choose the Right Partners

*As a bonus, we will take a brief look at the evolution of sex and relationships and how an “All-in” Relationship is the “Next Stage”

This workshop is for singles or couples.

Cost: This is a free intro
If you feel you like you got a lot of value and would like to contribute, we will have a basket for "love  offerings". 

The Four Forces Framework is a new approach developed over 20 years by Trish Blain.


Trish Blain had a kundalini awakening in her early twenties that set her on the path of sacred sexuality, consciousness and living an awake "all-in" life. She has been teaching for over 20 years and continues to be a student of life at the same time. She is currently starting an institute based on her multidisciplinary approach to living "all-in". It is called the Ollin Institute.<a></a>

results.description:
For our May meeting, we will be reading The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks by Rebecca Skloot. 

I am looking for some community space in JP so that we can have a potluck dinner for this meeting! 

"Her name was Henrietta Lacks, but scientists know her as HeLa. She was a poor black tobacco farmer whose cells—taken without her knowledge in 1951—became one of the most important tools in medicine, vital for developing the polio vaccine, cloning, gene mapping, and more. Henrietta's cells have been bought and sold by the billions, yet she remains virtually unknown, and her family can't afford health insurance. This phenomenal New York Times bestseller tells a riveting story of the collision between ethics, race, and medicine; of scientific discovery and faith healing; and of a daughter consumed with questions about the mother she never knew."

http://www.nytimes.com/2010/02/07/books/review/Margonelli-t.html?pagewanted=all

As always, please feel free to post any events in the Boston area that touch on feminism, social justice, or might be of general interest to this group!
results.name: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks

Come check out this timeless book that connects the prophecies concerning the house of David and the coming of Jesus, the Son of David!  Bring your Bible or grab a Bible at the door and join in the discussion!

Join us for our By-weekly meditation sessions designed to bring relaxation and awareness into your life. We meet every other  Wednesday of the month starting April 27th at The Stevens Estate in North Andover, MA.

Everyone is welcome!  

"It is fascinating to see the brain’s plasticity and that, by practicing meditation, we can play an active role in changing the brain and can increase our well-being and quality of life,” says Britta Hölzel, first author of the paper and a research fellow at MGH and Giessen University in Germany. “Other studies in different patient populations have shown that meditation can make significant improvements in a variety of symptoms, and we are now investigating the underlying mechanisms in the brain that facilitate this change.”

source: Harvard Gazette

results.description:
In this session, led by community member Eric Jones, you will identify your own unique purpose profile blend and discover ways to apply these concepts in your daily life decisions. You will learn the basics of the five life purpose profiles as discovered by Rhys Thomas. 

The life purpose profile system comes from a place of honoring a person’s unique gifts by focusing on the soul qualities while acknowledging ones defensive postures.In this way a person’s decisions in life can be quantified as either coming from a place of consciousness, heart centered core qualities or from a place of reaction and fear.

Come join us for an evening of insight and discovery about a very important aspect of life.

___________________________________________________

The intention of this salon is to build a community of people interested in personal growth and in sharing that with others. 


The meetings will be facilitated by a different member of the community each month. The first part of each meeting will be a time for people to share the difference personal growth made in their lives over the past month. The experiences shared may be from a new course/offering the person participated in or the result of any growth and development experience they had in the past. They may also share where in their lives  they feel that they need personal growth so that the community, and their participation in the Heart Beat Salon, may support them.

The second part of the evening will be a discussion of a personal growth topic as selected by the facilitator. The facilitator may or may not have in depth knowledge of the topic. Our intention is to hear from a members of the community and to not have this section be led by a professional. 

Our Topic This Evening Will ....


To Prepare ....


1)  What have been your personal growth experiences?   
2) What area of personal growth are you currently at work on? 
3) Is there personal growth you deem as necessary in your life?

Our Leader This Evening

Karen Putnam

Links

Most Important:

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:

• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing

• Accountability, so you actually get your work done and turn your dreams into reality

• Ideas and inspiration to help you make something new or improve what you already have

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do

Or, you can be a fly on the wall. No pressure at all. Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it (although we will say hello to you and give you the opportunity to introduce yourself, if you'd like).

Meeting Agenda:

7:00pm Join the meeting here:

https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/daviddrayton.com/weeklyautomatedincomemastermindmeeting

Each week, we do two things at our remote meetings, which we hold through Google Hangouts:

1) Part 1: Status check-ups (20-30 minutes): New members introduce themselves, sharing a bit about their goals and what they hope to get out of the group.  Existing members updates the group on the past week's biggest wins, and provide any other updates that stood out to them that week.

Each member may ask a short question or solicit help from the group as a whole before moving onto the next person, though any topics that deserve more than a minute or two of discussion will be moved to the next part of the meeting.

2) Part 2: Focus Groups (60 minutes+): The group splits out into two focus groups: one focused on selling physical products through platforms, and the other focused on producing and marketing online content.  Examples of the former may include people selling products on Amazon, Etsy, Ebay, through their e-commerce stores, etc.  Examples of the latter would include podcasters, bloggers, affiliate marketers, etc.

This second portion of the meeting may last for as long as the members within that focus group would like to extend the conversation, and members may hop on and off of either conversation at any time.

If you are in the physical product group, you can stay put in your current Google Hangout.  If you're in the online content marketing group, please join this hangout once Part 2 of the meeting begins:

https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/dq4qhhdefftaq3fmqwij2ipe2ea



Anyone can join. It doesn't matter where you are, how older you are, or even what stage of your business you're in. Our regular members include everyone from total beginners who are just getting their feet wet all the way up to serial entrepreneurs who are already making six-figures or more in their spare time doing this stuff.
results.how_to_find_us: Google Hangouts.  JOIN BY GOING TO  THIS LINK:  http://bit.ly/1XagvaN .  Note: you won't be able to join until the moderator has joined, so don't get discouraged if you see "Cannot join meeting."  Just try again in a minute or two.
results.name: Weekly Remote Mastermind Session

results.description:
Wednesday night is our (almost) weekly get-together for open gaming at the Panera Bread location in Porter Square. All are welcome to join us, regardless of experience level!


If you have a game you are particularly interested in playing, you are welcome and encouraged to bring it. But this is not required; many people typically bring a selection of their favorites and we're always happy to teach. The only things you need to bring are an open mind and a good attitude. If you're particularly hot to try something out, you are encouraged to leave a comment and see if you can drum up some interest beforehand. Please bear in mind that table space is limited, so an especially huge or epic game may not be appropriate for the venue (but see our Sunday night event at Pandemonium in Central Square for an alternative venue).


The event officially opens at 7 PM, but some people like to show up early; those who show up early should feel free to get started on a shorter warm-up game if time allows.


We look forward to seeing you at the gaming table!


WHERE WE SIT: Unless the restaurant is super-crowded, we gather in the basement dining area; just look for the games and say hi. We're friendly, honest!


GETTING THERE:


The Panera is located within easy walking distance of the Red Line T and several bus lines, and public transit is probably the easiest way of getting there. If you drive, mall parking is (theoretically) limited to 2 hours except where posted. I've never heard of anyone getting towed for overstaying this limit. For the extra-cautious, there are metered spots on Mass Ave; check the meter to be sure but most Cambridge meters don't need to be fed after 6 PM or 7 PM. There is also a Hubway bike-share station less than five minute's walk from the mall.


SOME NOTES:


As a group, we don't usually make a huge deal about attendance policy, however: attendance at these events is limited, and our Panera events are usually not huge; one side effect of this is that RSVPing and then not showing up can have a disruptive effect on our events, and for particularly popular events, "no shows" take up a spot from someone who wanted to be there. Bottom line: If you RSVP for a Panera event, please make a good-faith effort to show up or at least let us know if you can't make it.


As far as possible, please also let us know if you're going to be more than a few minutes late. As a rule of thumb, if we haven't heard from you and you arrive after 7:15 or so, you're likely to be limited to a spot at whatever game has room for an extra player. Much later than that, and we'll almost certainly be underway without you! You're welcome to show up and socialize and of course we'll try to accomodate you if we can, but we can't guarantee you a game. Because we as a group tend to play longer and more involved games, most groups at our events tend to play one and only one game per night.


Panera has been quite gracious about hosting our group with minimal fuss. To ensure that this happy state of affairs continues, please give them some business if you're hungry or thirsty and (especially) respect the hardworking people who work there, and their desire to go home after a long shift -- be ready to leave when the restaurant closes at ten.

results.description:
"Like being in Heaven"...."So wonderfully sacred"..."Wonderful feeling of love and bliss"
    This is a program for those interested in accessing and maintaining higher consciousness. Much of the evening is in silence as you receive 3 crown chakra activations to lift and expand your energy field, bringing you to a felt sense of union with divine Source energy. Expect to feel profound peace, openness, expansion, and love.  As all Lightbearers are invited and needed to extend and help hold higher vibrations for others on the planet, part of this class will include using meditation, intention and imagery to spread the vibrations we receive.


Sacred l music plays for the entire evening.  Expect to maintain higher consciousness, giving you a sense of non-dual awareness....being with what is...total acceptance of everything within you and outside of you.

We are all in our awakening process...becoming awake to the Presence within us and living, speaking, loving and creating from that place. To access and maintain that truth of who we really are requires us to let go of any limiting beliefs, habits, memories. Then we can more fully embrace and embody the higher consciousness of our true Self.

Judy guides this class based on her ongoing deep studies and experiences with conscious awakening.  The sweet, profound results of expansion in consciousness occurs in moments. At these meetings we can freely express and connect with like-hearted souls as we share in these powerful energy transmissions. All are welcome to join us and share your own experience of conscious awakening...your challenges, inspirations, intentions and joys. If being in sacred energy appeals to you, you will love this gathering..


"So much peace, it's amazing."

results.description:
Recently, the Time Magazine cover story made waves, claiming the pornography industry has created a public health crisis. Since the article, feminists and social conservatives have expounded further on the problems of pornography culture. Others have challenged that the problems are really as bad as they are made out to be. 

So what do you think? What problems, if any, do you see in a culture where pornography is more readily available (and, statistics show, more readily viewed)? What is the solution?

The Time Magazine article is not available to view without a Time subscription. But here is Conor Friedersdorf of The Atlantic responding, somewhat skeptically, to the article and other articles which followed:  http://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2016/04/porn-culture/477099/
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the back two booths (behind the bar). Ask a hostess for help if you have any trouble locating us.

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.

results.description:
Join 50 to 80 or 100 dancers any Wednesday at Dance Freedom!!

We are the original barefoot weekly dance, continuously running for 44 years, that has spawned hundreds if not thousands of other dances around the world.

In a drug, alcohol, and shoe-free environment, we've been making friends and sharing safe and juicy dances for decades. Come join the fun!! Discover the joy of dancing in a totally non-judgmental atmosphere, where anything safe and respectful goes... dance by yourself, in a group, with a same or opposite sex partner, or even just chat and enjoy watching.

First time visitors are welcomed heartily, and get in for half price! Otherwise, you decide what to pay in a range from $10 to $20, or less later in the evening as the event nears its end (information on late admission discounts is at the door). Our friendly dancers range from utterly new at it to very skilled dancers in funk, rock, salsa, modern, jazz, hip-hop, African & Latin and swing, tango, contact improvisation, and our own unique spontaneous creations! Dance with or alongside amazing dancers from local dance troupes as well as with ordinary good-hearted rug cutters. At work they may be doctors, lawyers, programmers, massage therapists, expressive therapists, artists, students, dog walkers, scientists, or anything else, but at heart they all love to dance.

The music runs the gamut: funk, world music, soul & r&b, house, trance, hip-hop, salsa, yoga music, jazz or swing, reggae, disco, you name it! Each DJ from our rotating list has a unique style, but we try to include something for everyone in every set. We keep a good balance in the music: familiar with unusual, timeless with current, melodic with drum-based, and positive lyrics with instrumentals--in all kinds of rhythms & styles! In any given evening, the world music parts of our dance are likely to include at least 3 or so of the following... African, Latin, Indian, Middle Eastern, Caribbean, zydeco, gypsy and much more. You'll hear everything from basic party music to very danceable songs with socially conscious lyrics, but you won't be hearing anything sexist, racist, violent, hating or otherwise divisive.

Start with a soothing stretch and warm up at 7:30, connect with the group and start to boogie at 7:50 with our first DJ of the evening, take a brief break at 8:50 for community announcements and a short unique performance or workshop (or chatting & stretching in a way that doesn't interfere), then cut the rug again by 9:15 at the latest with the evening's second DJ, till 10:30--plenty of time for a great workout and some feel-good inspiration and respiration and perspiration!

At the beginning of each half of the evening's music, everyone who wants to gathers around a centerpiece to hold hands, and dance in a winding chain together to a song with uplifting, connective (or at least beautiful and hypnotic) slow to medium tempo rhythms. (This dance was created from out of a drumming circle on the Cambridge Common in the sixties, after all, and some of that great political and community spirit still lives on here.) Then, it's all dance music, generally building in tempo to a crescendo, slowing down again for some more melodic and slow dance songs for a few minutes, then gradually building to a second crescendo. The second half of the evening's dance follows roughly the same pattern with a different DJ and style, and ends with another circle dance for those who enjoy it.

Dancers are always welcome to help with set-up or take-down, and get in free for doing so! It's a great chance to get to know the community better and be serviceful, as well as to save money and help us to be around for another 42 years... Welcome! For more information, E-mail: [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Opposite the Cambridge Common, see the Sheraton Hotel w/the big red letters COMMANDER on top.  Enter the stone church just left of hotel, @ entrance closest to hotel.  Follow the hall straight, left and right to the desk to sign in.
results.name: Dance Freedom Dj's Rose and Nina Facilitator Jessica

results.description:
Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish?
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice.
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls!
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle.

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones
The Veg Coach
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below.

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats
by Ellen Jaffe Jones

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen.  
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet.  
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving.  
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.

results.description:
Apache Apex is a native Hadoop data-in-motion/streaming platform that is used for ingestion, transformations, fast real-time analytics, ETL, disastor recovery, etc. dtIngest is a free application that enables ingestion into Hadoop from variety of sources. These include HDFS (disastor recovery), S3, NFS, FTP, Kafka, JMS.

Ingesting petabytes of data at scale in the native Hadoop environment encounters quite a few problems that need to be handled by a platform. Some of the known issues include handling of failure, parallel reading of the data and considering updates while the data is being ingested. While interacting with message bus, a lot of care has to be taken to ensure fault tolerance and  continuous ingestion.

This presentation will deep dive into application (dtIngest) for ingesting unbounded file data, and data ingestion from Kafka/JMS into Hadoop using the Apache Apex platform. All operators used in dtIngest are part of Apache Apex-Malhar. Download and try dtIngest. 

Presenter : Dr. Sandeep Deshmukh, Committer Apache Apex, DataTorrent Engineer

Please register at - https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/13685/194937

For deeper engagement with Apache Apex - ApacheApex, presentations, recordings, download, Apache Apex releases, docs

<a href="http://apex.apache.org/docs.html"></a>

This webcast is of a previous Apache Apex meetup event in Pune (IT Park, Bhau Patil Mark, Aundh Rd, Bopodi), we are webcasting it enable other BigFoots to participate. If you are interested in helping organize (hosting, presenting, community leadership) Apache Apex community, please email [masked]
results.name: Free App for easy ingestion into Hadoop from Kafka, JMS, NFS, S3, FTP, & HDFS

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Cooking Workshop starts at 5:30 but you may arrive at 7--please RSVP so that we know how many for whom to cook. We will be at the end of the long driveway  in the backyard. Meet us out back where we'll be Grilling outdoors.

We will also continue with the discussions for  our ad hoc Planning/Steering Committee for the Santo Cristo dos Milagres (Feast) Celebration next weekend on May 20th, 22 & 23rd in East Cambridge at St. Anthony's Church. The Festival itself starts at 6:30 p.m. with Holy Mass on Friday the 20th of May. Right after Mass we will meet for drinks (they sell beer, wine, Coke, excetera) where they are cooking sardines Under the Tent in the parking lot. 

TONIGHT (Thursday May 12th) we will discuss the purchasing & marinating of the meats, shopping for vegetables & preparing for skewering, then cooking and finally  serving  the BBQ. The communal dinner will take place late Sunday afternoon the 23rd of May.


As TODAY ( Thursday May 12th ) is the Saints' Day for  Saints Achelluus and Neurus -- two Roman soldiers who became Christian martyrs -- we will recite Evening Prayer from the Divine Office foot GRACE before dinner-- it takes about 10 minutes and is very much in the Monastic Tradition of "Ora et Labora" ("Pray & Work).

The Santo Christo Feast was Celebrated by Boston's own Cardinal Sean O'Malley in Portugal just a few years back with some of the local Priests of the Portuguese Community. In Portugal it is the largest Festival in the world held in October. Locally has been a favorite every May for many many years in East Cambridge at San Antonio Parish on the corner of Cambridge Street and Cardinal Medeiros Avenue.

Cooking Workshop TONIGHT STARTS at 5:30 but you may arrive at 7 to eat if you cannot attend the Workshop--just RSVP so that we know how much to put on the Grill!

This is a FREE EVENT--Please call 781-C-FRIARS for more information, etc.

results.description:
The rich story of the Jews of Venice is celebrated in this charming film, which uses an inventive mix of documentary and drama, animation, location photography, and interviews. Conjuring up 500 years of history, language, architecture, food, art, and politics-even the smells of market day-the film introduces us to Lorenzo (Laurence Olivieri), a Jewish teenager from New York, who is guided through Jewish Venice by his artist aunt (Sandra Toffolatti) . Together they explore the unique character of Venetian Jewish life, which began in the 14th century when Ashkenazi, Sephardic, and Levantine Jews arrived in Venice, then the center of trade between the East and West.
Director: Emanuela Giordano | Italy/France | 2015 | 54m | Italian & French w/ English subtitles

For the trailer, click here: https://vimeo.com/118681640

For info on ticket information, click here: http://www.mfa.org/programs/film/the-venice-ghetto-500-years-of-life

I will be driving in from Arlington, if you would like to carpool with me.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet outside the Remis Auditorium at 5:15
results.name: Celebrate the 500th Anniversary of the Venice Ghetto with a movie at the MFA

results.description:
Are We Smart Enough to Know How Smart Animals Are? (LINK)

Interview, Book Signing, and Reception with Frans de Waal, C.H. Candler Professor of Psychology and Director of the Living Links Center at the Yerkes National Primate Research Center, Emory University


Vicki Croke, New York Times bestselling author of Elephant Company and host of Boston WBUR’s The Wild Life, will moderate. 

Thursday, May 12th, 6pm

Harvard University Museum of Natural History

Geological Lecture Hall - 24 Oxford Street 

:: :: ::

Primatologist Frans de Waal has written a groundbreaking work that makes us rethink everything we know about animals. Based on research on species ranging from crows to elephants, he will reveal how intelligent animals really are and how much we underestimate their abilities. 

Presented in collaboration with WBUR, Boston’s NPR news station and the Peabody Museum of Archaeology & Ethnology

Reception supported by the Harvard Chapter of Sigma Xi

Free parking is available at the 52 Oxford Street Garage

Free and open to the public
results.name: Smart Animals ... (?)

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the unpaved municipal parking lot to the left of 72 Jefferson Street

results.description:
Abstract
The cloud is no longer only water molecules in the sky. Developing web applications today requires developers to be agile, faster than ever, and have the ability to scale on a moment’s notice. Come to this session see how ASP.NET Core is designed to be Cloud Ready so you can build applications that are ready for the modern web. You will learn about new features in ASP.NET Core and see how improvements to the ASP.NET architecture make developing for the cloud faster. By the end of the session you will have a firm understanding of why a new version ASP.NET was developed, how it impacts you as a developer and how to begin to leverage ASP.NET to build modern cloud applications.

Bio
James is a Tech Evangelist for Microsoft. He has been working in the web development space for 10+ years working with startups and enterprises to improve the way they do business through technology. James has extensive experience working with startups during the growth phase helping them deliver the product that their customers have asked for. He is focused on automating development workflows that allow companies to achieve more. When he isn’t practicing his software craft James can be found running through the woods, growing hops, or hiking with his daughter.
results.name: James Sturtevant: ASP.NET Core Introduction

6:00-7:00 Networking, Introductions, Food and Refreshments

7:00-7:45 - Hyperconvergence 3.0 with SimpliVity

Description: 

Virtualization has been widely adopted by the IT industry but existing architectures were designed before the introduction of virtualization adding complexities that blunt the benefits. The answer is to provide an architecture that accommodates virtualization instead of trying to “shoehorn” it into a legacy design. Hyperconvergence from SimpliVity maximizes the benefits of virtualization. It is the future of IT.Did you know that IDC reported that the hyper-converged market will grow at a 65% CAGR from[masked], 4 to 5 times the rate of conventional infrastructure. Why?… Hyperconvergence enables a drastically simplified data center, built for virtualized applications, designed to dramatically improve operational efficiency, increase data protection and lower TCO allowing organizations to move to market faster with new application development. SimpliVity is a leading Hyper-Converged Infrastructure solutions provider. Based in Westborough, they are one of Massachusetts’ five "technology unicorns" (companies valued at over $1B). And, they are the only vendor to offer Hyperconverged 3.0 features and benefits.Their solution includes an advanced accelerator card enabling them to maximize virtual machine performance, reduce IOPs and minimize bandwidth requirements. We will lead a discussion around the following topics: 

1. The challenges in the data center today

2. The changing of the guard

3. The vision for a simplified data center

4. How to sort through the hype in the marketplace

SimpliVity is so confident in their revolutionary Data Virtualization Platform they guarantee a 10:1 data reduction via deduplication and compression and they also guarantee to Backup & Restore a 1TB Virtual Machine in less than 60 seconds. 

On average, customers achieve a 30:1 ratio. Learn more here and see the phone home data here.  Independent studies have shown SimpliVity's customers save 224% ROI with a 6.6 month payback on average. Please come to our MeetUp and learn more… We look forward to meeting you! 

Speaker Bio

Dan Pearl, Regional Sales Executive

Dan is an excellent speaker and advocate for the benefits of Hyperconvergence and the advantages provided by SimpliVity's unique Data Virtualization Platform. Currently, Dan is the Regional Sales Executive for SimpliVity responsible for managing sales in the Greater Boston area. Previously he held technical leadership roles at both EMC and Oracle. His knowledge base includes the traditional legacy data center stack and the contrast offered by Hyperconvergence..


8:00-8:45: Kaspersky Lab - Different Approaches to Virtualization Security

Description:

Virtual Desktop Infrastructure security: tomorrow's scenarios and today's problems

Today's Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) technologies are on the brink of offering a wealth of new possibilities. From running resource-heavy applications to hosting your entire desktop infrastructure in the cloud - only yesterday, all this was impossible. But the proliferation of technologies and increased VDI adoption rates also introduce new security issues. Benefits offered by VDI include data security (no critical data on remote/mobile devices), hardware agnosticism, flexible control over the working environment and easy, centralized, applications provisioning. Retaining the user experience delivered by physical workstations, with fast response times and similar working patterns, is usually a prerequisite, but thanks to VDI solutions (such as VMware Horizon View) this in fully attainable. However, the benefits of virtualization can easily be eroded if the specifics of such systems are not taken into full account. And with virtualized infrastructures offering attack surfaces directly comparable to those of their physical counterparts, this is particularly true when it comes to protection. Many vendors do offer specialized solutions for virtualized environments. But these tend to show their shortcomings when it comes to desktop environments. Resource consumption, for example, or lack of specific protective capabilities (such as controlling processes in RAM), make many virtualization security solutions unsuitable for protecting VDIs. Specific usage scenarios can also introduce challenges - so that even the most conventional malware attacks can have severe effects. Further VDI proliferation and the centralization of valuable data storage will inevitably attract increased interest from cybercriminals. Potentially terrifying Proof-of-Concept attack scenarios could soon become our new realities. Understanding this, Kaspersky Lab's virtualization security solution offers a technology specifically designed to address such issues: the Light Agent. While avoiding VDI bottlenecks, the technology offers a full spectrum of multi-layered protection for virtualized workstations and supports the vast majority of known usage scenarios.


8:45- Cleanup and prizes 

Swag Alert !!
(Hint - Don't miss this one!)

results.name: Hyperconvergence 3.0 with SimpliVity & Security with Kaspersky Lab

results.description:
Hi All,

Only two more days until the event! I hope to see you all there.

Our First meetup will be focused on H2O, an open-source Machine Learning Platform. This event is being sponsored by Colaberry School of Data Analytics. 

http://www.h2o.ai/


https://github.com/h2oai/h2o-3


It will take place the CIC on Milk Street in Boston.. the Date is set for 5/12 at 6:00PM. This Date is Final. 

Event Itinerary

6pm Cocktails/Apps meet and greet.

7pm Erin from H2O to present and live code session, bring your laptops. 

8pm Pizza for everyone more networking opportunity. 

Speaker: Erin LeDell 


NOTE: Bring Laptops if you want to partake in hands on demo. 

ABSTRACT:

This workshop will provide an overview of how to use H2O, the scalable open source machine learning library, from Python/R/Flow UI. The core algorithms of H2O are implemented in Java, however, fully-featured APIs are available in R, Python, Scala, and also through the Flow UI web interface. The focus of this hands-on workshop will be the “h2o” R & Python modules. All of H2O's algorithm implementations are distributed, which allows the software to scale to large datasets that may not fit into RAM on a single machine. H2O currently features distributed implementations of Generalized Linear Models, Gradient Boosting Machines, Random Forest and Deep Neural Nets. In this workshop, attendees will learn how to train machine learning models, cross-validation, and evaluate model performance using the H2O Python and R API


BIO:

Erin LeDell received her Ph.D. in Biostatistics with a Designated Emphasis in Computational Science and Engineering from UC Berkeley. Additionally, she has B.S. and M.A. in Mathematics and have worked for many years in industry as a software developer and data scientist. Her research focuses on ensemble machine learning, learning from imbalanced binary-outcome data, influence curve based variance estimation and statistical computing.

Currently, Dr. LeDell works as a Statistician and Machine Learning Scientist at H2O.ai, the company behind the open source machine learning software, H2O.

Please no recruiters.  


Best,


David
results.name: Scalable Machine Learning with H2O

results.description:
On Thursday, May 12th starting at 6:00, the MobileTea meetup and MassTLC will present the 10th edition of MobileTea. This evening event consists of knowledge and networking for anyone interested in innovative programming languages and practices for mobile developers. 


Participation is “free as in beer” and consists of 4 keynote speakers interspersed with 4 networking sessions that include live DJ’d music and hors d'oeuvres.  

Presentations will vary from 20 to 40 minutes and are followed by 15 minutes of networking.  Be prepared for an informal atmosphere, great food and drink.  Bring your passion for all things development, we look forward to meeting you!

Performing live: Subway DJ @Subway_DJ   
Mixologist: Chris Allen (Red5 Pro)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Registrations open at 6:00 PM, the event starts at 6:30 PM.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Event Program:

Networking Session 1 - DJ Mix 1 - Food & Drink  

Sharing Code Between Web and Native Apps [Jen Looper @jenlooper]
NativeScript has opened up a whole new world to Angular developers: the ability to share code—directly—between your web and native iOS/Android applications. Which is awesome! But, just because you can share code across multiple platforms, doesn’t mean that you necessarily should. In this talk we’ll first take a look at what NativeScript makes possible from a code sharing perspective. Come for practical tips & tricks on sharing code across multiple development environments.
(speech level: intermediate; duration: 25 minutes) 

Networking Session 2 - DJ Mix 3 - Food & Drink  

Parse Server in the Azure Cloud [Lucy Monahan @SoFetching]
Parse Platform is a cloud app platform currently available via a hosted service on parse.com. In January Facebook announced that the Parse hosted service at parse.com will be shut down in January 2017 and the Parse Platform will be open-sourced for continued development. Just three months after the announcement the open source Parse Platform has a thriving ecosystem for mobile developers.
This lightning talk will show how easy it is to spin up a Parse Server on Azure cloud with a MongoDB at the backend.  The demo whips up a small Android app to show data being saved all the way through to MongoDB. 
(speech level: intermediate; duration: 20 minutes) 

Networking Session 3 - DJ Mix 3 - Food & Drink  


Switching to React and Redux: One Startup’s Adventure [Chris Schuch] 


Given the plethora of modern JavaScript libraries now available to build rich client-side applications, picking a technology stack has become one of the most important decisions front-end developers are faced with when beginning a new project. Facebook's ReactJS is one of the most exciting and fastest growing UI libraries, which is commonly paired with an application state management framework such as Flux or Redux. This talk will focus on our startup's journey to replace our outdated server-side web application with a modern front-end stack consisting of ECMAScript 6, ReactJS, and Redux from initial design through go-live. Topics will include an overview of the frameworks involved, our approach to utilizing them in a production system, and lessons learned throughout the process.
(speech level: intermediate; duration: 25 minutes) 

Networking Session 4 - DJ Mix 4 - Food & Drink   

A Gentle Introduction to Xamarin [Joseph Hill @JosephHill]
Xamarin is cross-platform dev software for simplifying mobile application creation. Recently acquired by Microsoft, the platform enables developers to build native apps for all major mobile devices. Joseph Hill, Co-Founder and COO of Xamarin will walk through some of the basics of developing with it, core capabilities, testing, and how you can use the chops you already have in C#, Objective-C, Java, and hybrid languages to build or enhance the quality of apps.(speech level: intermediate; duration: 25 minutes) 


Networking Session 5 - DJ Mix 5 - Food & Drink
results.name: Mobile Tea #10 + MassTLC: programmer, c'est tout un art!

results.description:
Join us for a fun, stimulating evening of group critique and discussion.

New members are always welcome. We'll be prepared to discuss work in any genre, prose or verse. Bring enough copies of the text you’d like to discuss for each workshop attendee to have their own. If you do not have the means to make copies, send the text by attachment to bostonpoetryunion (at) gmail (dot) com not later than the night before the workshop.

Occasionally, the moderator will invite a member or guest speaker to open the session with a brief talk on some literary topic. If you’re interested in delivering such a talk, email the organizers and let them know! We are similarly open to suggestions for writing exercises, discussions at members' homes, visits to readings or bookstores, and other events of interest to writers.

ABOUT THE WORKSHOP: Now in its 14th year, the weekly Boston Poetry workshop (formerly “Charles River Writers”) is an open, accessible, and welcoming forum for literary fellowship and discussion. Please note: In 2016, our Thursday night workshops will run in six-week blocks, in winter, spring, summer, and fall.

This session is our last workshop of the spring!
results.how_to_find_us: Call or text 617-935-4951 if you can't spot us.
results.name: Weekly Writers' Workshop: Spring Sessions, #5 of 6

REGISTRATION IS NOW OPEN for the spring season of the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League! This year we’re pleased to announce an expanded offering of locations. 

Site Locations, Match Times and Starting Dates:

South Boston, MA @Joe Moakley Park: Wednesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 11th) 

South Boston, MA @ Joe Moakley Park: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th) 

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Wednesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 11th)

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th)

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Tuesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 10th) 

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th) 

League Format:

The format for the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League will be the same as last year – 7 weeks, 6 teams, 1-hour long matches, and restaurant specials after on-court play. results.description:
Walkers & Joggers Welcome

May 3, 2016 @ 6:15PM (every Tuesday and Thursday night for 9 wks)

We're here to help you achieve your goal of beginning to run your first 5K. Too many people have been turned off of running simply by trying to start off too fast. Their bodies rebel, and they wind up miserable, wondering why anyone would possibly want to run in the first place. You should ease into your 5K training plan gradually. In fact, the beginners' program we outline here is less of a running regimen than a walking and jogging program. The idea is to transform you from couch potato to runner, getting you to begin running a 5K or 3.1 miles and on a regular basis in just two months.  Each session should take about 20 or 30 minutes, three times a week. That just happens to be the same amount of moderate exercise recommended by numerous studies for optimum fitness. This program will get you fit. 

We will be meeting twice a week, so you SHOULD train the 3rd time on your own either on Saturday or Sunday to keep with the schedule.  Remember to bring your sneakers and some water.
  http://www.coolrunning.com/engine/2/2_3/181.shtml


Inclement Weather: Heavy rains will cancel. We will train if it is overcast or there is a slight drizzle. Please plan to bring a lightweight jacket with a hood just in case.

results.description: Why Were Early Humans Successful and Other Hominins Not? - Christian Tryon -  A Science by the Pint Event ...
results.name: Early Humans (Science by the Pint)

results.description:
"Why Were Early Humans Successful and Other Hominins Not?"
guest scientist Christian Tryon

Meet Us Thursday, May 12th, 6:30pm at Aeronaut Brewery!

Christian Tryon is a Paleolithic archaeologist in the Department of Anthropology at Harvard University. He is interested in the behavioral evolution of Homo sapiens and the role that archaeology can play in understanding the evolutionary success of our species. His primary research area is eastern Africa, where he has directed a number of field projects in Kenya since 2001. Dr. Tryon's current research focuses on the co-variation of ancient environments and human behavior. He is particularly interested in the analysis of stone tools and what they tell us about human behavior and the environment, as well as modern human dispersals across and out of Africa.

Science by the Pint is a monthly science cafe free and open to the public, run by the Harvard non-profit outreach group Science In The News (SITN). Read more here:


http://sitnboston/science-by-the-pint/
results.name: Science by the Pint: Why Were Early Humans Successful and Other Hominins Not?

This is not your average dinner party. You might be put to work!

During the cooking class, you will sample charcuterie, cheese, and wine while Chef Jason guides us through instructions. 

After eat the lovely food we watched being prepared, our group will be able to privately browse the wine shop and receive 10% off any purchases made. You will also be able to buy the wine you tasted during the class.

This is a small setting in a working kitchen, which means it might get a little warm. So please dress appropriately.

PAYMENT DETAILS:

Your payment of $60 will include: the cooking class, samples during the class (charcuterie, cheeses, wine, etc.), the dinner cooked during the class, as well as the opportunity to meet great people. Your payment is requested at time of RSVP to hold your spot. 

• Payment does NOT include tip; which is at your discretion.

RSVP spots will open 3 weeks prior to the event. To ensure your spot is reserved, submit payment via one of the following four methods: 

• PayPal: Click here to access TABdetails quickly, or [masked] within your PayPal account.  Be sure to use the "Friends and Family" option; we are not a business and all money collected goes straight to the venue to pay for the TAB. 

• Venmo: TABdetails

• Google wallet:  [masked]

Of course it wouldn't hurt to include a memo in the payment of "Dave's Fresh Pasta"; or something of the sort.

If none of these payment options work for you, we will accept cash at the door. Please message Sarah indicating this is your preference. We will let you know if this is an option for this event and whether or not your spot will be confirmed.

TRANSPORTATION TIPS:

Dave's Fresh Pasta is about a 4 minute walk from the Davis Square stop on the Red Line. In addition to metered parking, the closest metered parking lot is on the corner of Buena Vista Rd & Holland St.

Agenda:

"Clojure Love: A Totally Biased Introduction" will be a presentation/demo followed by discussion and interactive "hands-on" exploration of some interesting Clojure features. Feel free to bring a laptop with Clojure installed if you want to "follow along" - but this is strictly optional.


The goal is not a dispassionate discussion of Clojure pros and cons, but rather a gentle introduction to explain and demonstrate why Clojure is the best thing since sliced bread - a highly enjoyable (fun!) language that's also very practical.

This presentation will be appropriate for newcomers to Clojure. Welcome! And if you're a more seasoned Clojurista please come and share your own Clojure love stories. :)


Hope to see you all there!

results.description:
The Boston Austrian Economics Group will discuss the economics of Joseph Schumpeter, who popularized the notion of "Creative Destruction."

The reading this week will be an essay in Capitalism Magazine by Richard Ebeling titled "Economist Joseph Schumpeter: Father of Capitalist 'Creative Destruction'". The reading is not required, and all are welcome to attend.

Fuji is located near the Orange Line Sullivan Square T stop, and there is free parking in the large parking garage in Assembly Row. Call Andrew at (917)[masked] with any questions.

STUDY QUESTIONS

1. What elements of Schumpeter’s early work were “Austrian”? What elements were “un-Austrian”?

2. What addition to the “circular flow” model of the economy did Schumpeter introduce?

3. Was money neutral, or a “veil for barter”, in Schumpeter’s later work?

4. Was Schumpeter’s business cycle theory the same as Mises?

5. What did Schumpeter have to say about “perfect competition” and “monopoly”?

6. How does Schumpeter’s view of history relate to Marx’s?

7. Did Schumpeter agree with Marx that capitalism correlated with empire?

8. Schumpeter was an economist from Austria, but did he want to be associated with the other
economists from Austria?

9. What was the critique Schumpeter made in his later work toward mathematical economics?

10. Name some instances of creative destruction. What does this process look like for land? For capital? For labor?
results.how_to_find_us: We will be the table with the papers on it.
results.name: Schumpeter and Creative Destruction

results.description:
We will take a look at the FREE tools that you can use to maintain your privacy online, and discuss which ones are best for your needs.

Security and privacy - what does it mean to you in your everyday life? It used to be hard to use the tools that safeguard your identity and your information online. You had to be a pretty technical person - the good news is that it has gotten easier to be secure in your online persona.

These are some of the tools we will look at:

1. Off-the-Record (OTR) Messaging allows you to have private conversations over instant messaging.
2. Email Encryption using Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) is a data encryption and decryption computer program that provides cryptographic privacy and authentication for data communication. There is also the GnuPG system here: https://emailselfdefense.fsf.org/en
3. Tails is a live operating system, that you can start on almost any computer from a DVD, USB stick, or SD card. It aims at preserving your privacy and anonymity.

There are also some great apps for secure texting and secure phones that provide end-to-end encryption for your calls, securing your conversations so that nobody can listen in. There is no way to be bulletproof, but knowing about the options available can provide a measure of security. It is ultimately up to you to decide how much security you want.

Link to hangout: https://plus.google.com/hangouts/_/event/cjfhrydio4rhi9bpgih1coop154?hl=en
results.how_to_find_us: https://plus.google.com/hangouts/_/event/cjfhrydio4rhi9bpgih1coop154?hl=en
results.name: Virtual Meetup: Staying Safe - Overview of FREE Encryption Tools

results.description:
Our children trigger us in ways that no one else can and they shine the light on emotions that we have seldom seen in ourselves prior to having them.

While many of us know that yelling is not beneficial to our kids or ourselves, it can feel like one of the hardest things to change. In this workshop we will look not only at how anger and yelling affects our relationship with our children, but learn to see our children’s behavior with a new lens. We will discuss tools and strategies to manage ourselves in those challenging moments and find ways to respond to our children rather than react. 

Workshop Facilitator: Cindy Kaplan, MA is a parent coach, a family therapist, and a yoga practitioner. Please visit Cindy's website to read more about her and available services.

results.description:
Hi friends,

I work at the Museum of Science, and my department puts on events approximately once per month. They're on science and technology topics, and they involve speaker presentations followed by guided discussions, which we call forums. I'd love if you wanted to come to one (or more!) of my programs, either to support me or because you're interested in the topic. They're free, open to the public, and have refreshments - what more could you want?

The May one is called Brain-Enhancing Drugs at School: Smart or Not? It's about the growing use of drugs like Adderall and Ritalin as a study aid without a prescription. You can see a description here: http://www.mos.org/public-events/brain-enhancing-drugs-at-school

If you want to come, you should sign up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/brain-enhancing-drugs-at-school-smart-or-not-registration-20708370293 and feel free to also RSVP on this meetup event so people know you're going :)

If you have any questions, feel free to post a comment or send me a message.

Thanks!

Caroline

results.description:
Good News Everyone! 


The poll for this month was fantasy. The poll decided that we will be reading Deathless by Catherynne M. Valente this month! See links below for more information about the book.

We will be meeting at Comicazi on Highland Ave in Davis Square. There is metered parking all along Highland as well as a public metered lot on Highland near the Rite Aid (and an unmetered lot behind the Rite Aid), Day Street near Redbones, and across the street from Orleans restaurant on Holland. There is also T access and bus connections through Davis Square T station.

You can find Deathless by Catherynne M. Valente on Amazon, B&N, Porter Square Books, or through the Minuteman Library system. Learn about it on Goodreads<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/13453029-wool-omnibus-silo-1?from_search=true"></a>.

results.description:
Join us to eat, drink, write, share work, trade author/book recommendations, and more!

Thursday Format:
After a round of introductions, we start out with a general, unstructured freewrite to get everyone in the writing mindset. We continue writing to a series of three or so writing prompts that usually one of the organizers has prepared before hand. Members are encouraged to share their work, or what they wrote about, for each prompt. We spend the remainder of the group working on our own separate projects, continuing work from one of the prompts, freewriting, or just chatting with each other.

When we have a piece to workshop, we often will write to two or so prompts, and then will go into a discussion of that piece. The workshop may take up the rest of the group, or may conclude with time left at the end.


Read more about workshops here.

results.description:
DOORS: 7:30PM
SHOW: 8PM (ends by 10PM)
MORE INFO:http://wmbr.org/ampersand

Psychedelic Cinema Orchestra
Music:https://youtu.be/EcjbEYQZJsM
Video:https://vimeo.com/93166266

Psychedelic Cinema Orchestra is a music and video collaboration between Ken Winokur (percussion and junk; Alloy Orchestra), Jonathan LaMaster (violin, guitars, electronics; Cul de Sac), Russ Gershon (horns and electronics; Either/Orchestra). Between 1967 and 1969, Ken Brown shot super 8 films to project with the Road Show light show at Boston’s premiere rock club The Boston Tea Party. The resulting films, cobbled together to make the current PSYCHEDELIC CINEMA, stand today as an amazing window on another time.

This show will be two hours of nonstop visual/audio thrills, including new Psychedelic Cinema visual material, a Live Liquid Light Show feat. Allie Coppola, and "Sublings" feat. DJs Flack and Pace doing live video scratching with music.

Don't forget to stop by before the show starts to check out the List Gallery upstairs. Free admission!
results.name: Psychedelic Cinema Orchestra: Old School Psych

results.description:
Grab tickets NOW: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sketchhaus-tickets-19934059308

Y'all ready for two of the weirdest and funniest sketch groups in the Boston Metro area, also in the world? GET READY. This is happening: First up, it's Mister Bismuth - The collective minds of sexually adventurous sketch group Mister Bismuth bring you the latest in their special brand of humor, making you laugh, cry, and question everything. From their short films Bleak Moments and Inexorable, to their runs at SketchHaus, Miyamoto's Revenge and Super Gay Comedy Fun Time, this group will have you rolling in the aisles. Maybe from joy, maybe from diarrhea. Pepto not provided.

THEN YOUR HEADLINER! Ike & Clark - Sam Ike and Laura Clark are best friends despite having very little in common. The show they do together is a mix of stand up, storytelling and sketches about love, death, sex, racism, feminism and Drake songs. Your host is the brilliant and hilarious Niraj Shah! Our special guest star is the equally hilarious Liam McGurk! Produced by Kevin Quigley, the guy writing this promo. A slopton of sketch and comedy for only $12. THERE'S ALSO BEER.

PLUS: OpenHaus is back! Boston's only sketch comedy open mic is here for *you* to showcase new, developing, or experimental work. You bring the scripts, we provide the audience and the actors. Thursday is gonna be awesome, everyone!

results.description:
SUBJECTS 20-21

20 Landscape: Nightowl - A tripod is going to be handy... time to shoot a night landscape.  Look for some light for the scene, IE: car lights, city lights, or maybe just moonlight.


21 Artistic: Fantasy - Is this real life, or is this just fantasy... Your artistic inspiration this week is fantasy.


 22 Portrait: Hands - Usually the face is the strongest element in the frame; with the hands being second. Make the hands the most important element in your image this week.

*** Upload 1 or 2 images per subject max.
*** Please try to Caption your work.
*** Please make constructive, appreciative comments on a minimum of 2 other images for every image you post.
*** 1 image from your library can be shared per subject, but the object is to take new images.
*** Images should be uploaded between May 13th and Jun 12th


If anyone has suggestions or an on-line source that would be helpful to a specific subject, please share in the comments for the challenge.

results.description:
This webinar will look at the difference between empathy and sympathy; help you understand empathy in the context ofEmotional Intelligence; and suggest ways to deepen empathy. 


Please note: This webinar will not send an email confirmation, make sure to add this event to your calendar, and log in to Webinara, to start the webinar on time.

To Attend This Webinar You Must RegisterHERE 

Why attend this webinar:

1. Learn about the differences between sympathy and empathy.

2. More in depth knowledge of empathy will help strengthen current relationships, and forge new ones.

3. Tips to enable empathy to become a more natural part of your personality.

More information about the speakers:

Q. Learning Ltd -Richard Carr - Managing Director

Richard is guided by a belief in the vital importance in giving people and organisations an opportunity to learn, develop and grow. This belief, and his desire to do the right things in the right way with the right people, are principles that run through every aspect of Richard’s personal and professional life.

Recording available 

Slides/PDF available

Information about the Organizer:

Q. Learning is a management consultancy specialising in: - Transformation and change management - Leadership and management development - Team, group and organisational collaboration We have developed diagnostic and assessment tools around 360 degree leadership, partnership working, personal development and board effectiveness. We are also an approved ILM Centre and an MHS EQi registered training centre and distributor.

To Attend This Webinar You Must Register HERE 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

P.S. We'd love your support and help in answering just a few questions if you are a current or former smoker...

We are building an IoT app that uses deep AI, Machine Learning and Gamification to help smokers quit!

The survey takes just a couple of minutes and by participating you will have the opportunity to win 1 of 500 KwitCase T-shirts. 

The survey is HERE.

On behalf of the Kwitcase Team,

Thank you :)

Jeff Robinson and Anna Morera Leralta

results.description:
10am - 3pm including lunch and happy hour!

The millennial generation brings with them different expectations on how they want to be connected to their organization, how they want to be recognized, the environment that gets the best from them, and how their career and personal goals work together. Millennials are forecasted to make up 75% of the workforce by 2025 and are going to shape the world of work for years to come. Understanding the differences to engaging this important demographic is critical to the future of your business.

 Join us on Friday, May 13th to gain valuable insight on how to get the most from this important demographic. Topics include: 

Recruiting Millennials: Discover how recruitment has to change if we want to attract the best millennial talent. 

Company Culture As THE Competitive Advantage: Discover the employee engagement techniques Reward Gateway used to grow into a $250m business with 350 staff across 7 locations in 10 years. 

Health Is Your Greatest Wealth. Understand how to help your millennials align mind, body, and soul to maximize their full potential. 

Communicating To Millennials: Learn about the tactics global IT company Markit uses to communicate effectively to their employees around the globe

This is a free event and includes coffee and pastries, lunch, and a happy hour
results.name: 'The How and Why to Engage Gen Y'

results.description:
If you remember the 1v1 Brass tournaments we had going for a while, this is a similar sort of thing but for the GBCC's community of Food Chain Magnate fans. It will work in the same way -- everyone signed up for the tournament will be paired up in a bracket, like the NCAA basketball tournament or a tennis tournament. Winners advance, losers go home.

I've played the 2 player game of Food Chain Magnate a couple of times, and while it's not quite as strategically rich as the 3-5 player game, it's still quite interesting. It has the additional advantage of being speedy; at a normal pace of play it's quite easy to finish a 2 player game in a week or two, and with a little effort it can finish far more quickly than that. This is the competition for those of you who are interested in online Food Chain Magnate but find 3- or 4- player games too chaotic or choppy!

All are welcome in this competition, regardless of your prior participation or non-participation in the Electric Lunch League. A basic knowledge of the rules of the game is strongly recommended. There is a pretty good introduction to the interface on the boardgamecore site.
results.name: Arch Madness, Edition 1 (Online 1v1 Food Chain Magnate tournament)

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
All Are Invited: Lunchtime Meet Up at Rebecca's Café!
 SPC members have long expressed an interest in an additional channel for unstructured networking and just plain schmoozing about their business triumphs and trials.
Here's how it works: You just show up! No need to pay a fee.
Rick Pollack of Presentation Medic, a member of the SPC Board, has volunteered to anchor this gathering. This meeting is a bring your own agenda, or just enjoy lunch with other consultants.
Find yourself something appealing to nosh on, settle at the cash register, and join the group. We've picked 1 p.m. on a Friday as our start time to avoid the crush and let people take as much time as they feel they can afford...and maybe start a new conversation they can pick up later!
Mark your calendar now ... you don't even have to sign up on our website!

results.description:
This looks a roller coaster ride of thrills.   Will the evil financial investor get killed or not....let's see if Clooney can make us care about his character in spite of what he does for a living.  


Showtime is at 7:45.  I will be at the theater by 6:45.  Since the movie is showing upstairs, we will gather at the tables by the windows at the top of the escalator.  We will head in for seats at 7:15.  Tickets are on sale on Fandango now.

In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group. No separate checks.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

Movie Details:

Release date: May 13, 2016

Studio: TriStar Pictures (Sony)

Director: Jodie Foster

MPAA Rating: N/A

Screenwriters: Jamie Linden, Alan DiFore, Jim Kouf

Starring: George Clooney, Julia Roberts, Jack O'Connell, Dominic West, Giancarlo Esposito, Caitriona Balfe

Genre: Thriller

Plot Summary:

In the real-time, high stakes thriller Money Monster, George Clooney and Julia Roberts star as financial TV host Lee Gates and his producer Patty, who are put in an explosive situation when an irate investor who has lost everything (Jack O'Connell) forcefully takes over their studio. During a tense standoff broadcast to millions on live TV, Lee and Patty must work furiously against the clock to unravel the mystery behind a conspiracy at the heart of today's fast-paced, high-tech global markets.
results.name: Money Monster (7:45PM Show)

results.description:
Join the Food Business Association's first Legal Round Table, and ask an Attorney your questions about how to open a food business. Even if you don't want to ask any legal questions, join us afterwards from 7-8pm for a Networking Hour.

The bar will be open from 7-8pm for the purchase of beer and wine, and there will be free bar snacks.

May 13, 2016

6 - 7 pm - Legal Round Table

7 - 8pm - Networking (bar will be open for beer and wine purchases)

Cost: $38 per person

Space is limited, and you must purchase a ticket on Eventbrite. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/legal-round-table-how-to-open-a-food-business-tickets-25291983002

For a low, fixed cost you can participate in our Round Table with Attorney Kim Courtney, a Massachusetts Attorney with extensive experience in permits, licensing, commercial kitchen build outs, shared commercial kitchens, and liquor licensing.

This first Round Table will invite broad questions about opening a food business, with more specific and detailed Round Tables to come. If you would like to submit suggested topics, please comment on the Meetup page http://www.meetup.com/FoodBusinessAssociation/events/230955210/.

This is a great forum because it not only allows you to ask your questions to an attorney for a low fixed rate, but you will also learn from the questions of other participants.

Snacks and bar services catered by CookHouse.
results.name: Legal Round Table - Starting a Food Business

results.description:
Artist Opening May 13th 6-8pm for Artist of The Month, Sandrine Colson

*Throughout the month of May, the Dedham Square Artists Guild presents "Along The Country Side", a solo exhibit, with original artwork by Sandrine Colson (aka Sanya), DSAG artist.

"Along the Country Side" is an exhibit where Sandrine invites her viewers to follow her along her travels though out the countryside, visiting various places from her travels, especially her native Provence in France.

In this series Sandrine expresses her personal ideas about landscapes. The compositions are colorful, referencing natural forms and movement, filled with bright paint swirls of color and texture.

Sandrine Colson signs her work as Sanya and Sandrine. Born in Provence, France, she is a world traveler and has visited many countries in the Americas, Africa, Asia and Europe. She lived in France, various parts of the US, and now resides in Boston.

Her work has been exhibited in many galleries, museums and other venues throughout New England, the US as well as Europe: France and Spain. Her studio is based in Charlestown, MA. She is presently focusing on mastering her art as a painter, mixed media and jewelry artist.

Visit her web site, www.artofheart.com for additional information.
results.name: Artist Reception for Sandrine Colson At The Dedham Guild
