results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Potbelly Sandwich Shop behind CVS (on Somerville Ave) 

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. You can easily spot Potbelly Sandwich Shop on side entrance when you arrive at top of escalator at Porter Square Station. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

results.description:
<a href="http://atwysbostonspeeddate.eventbrite.com/"></a>

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  An icebreaker will be provided to held facilitate mingling. Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>
results.name: SpeedMeeting - Singles Ages 36-48 - 1F/3M SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
Finally...I have found a source for fresh rabbit. My favorite meat purveyor, M. F. Dullock is carrying locally sourced rabbit. The farmer is particular about how and when he harvests so this guaranteed to be special. The gnocchi are a made with semolina cooked with milk and brown butter, cut into a dumpling that is oven roasted with shaved parmesan. The brown butter is a Marianne addition, not a traditional ingredient. I can easily make a vegetarian version of this for those that do not want to eat rabbit. There will be of course lots of other courses before and after so come hungry. Dinner is $60. Payment is expected when you RSVP. You can make a payment by either using

Venmo ID Marianne Marrone

or Google Wallet user ID: [masked]

Please let me know at the time that you register if you have any allergies. I will not be able accommodate anyone with a dairy or wheat allergy or aversion.

I am looking forward to seeing you and feeding you.

M

It would be great to schedule regular walks ... this is a "tester." Let's meet in front of the Heartbreak Hill Running Company at 638 Comm Ave, at the corner of Comm Ave and Centre Street in Newton.

Lots of street parking on Sundays on Comm Ave and the side streets. And lots of lovely streets to walk along, including Comm Ave. It'll be about an hour to chat and walk -- hope to see you!

If there's a question about the weather, I'll post a message. You can also call me:[masked] 2057.

(I'm open to scheduling regular walks on other days and times, so feel free to send a message about your best times, or let me know at this walk. There are many other places we could meet up, too.)

Have a good week, everyone.

Amy

Coro-Dante, directed by Kevin Galiè, accompanied by Ilana Cady, is New England's only all-Italian repertoire chorus.  This is always a fun, well-attended event.

Free and open to all. Refreshments following the concert.

After this concert we will take the summer off and resume rehearsals in September.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/andala-coffee-house-cambridge-2 You must have a look around, great atmosphere, give yourselves a tour then sit down.

Great event at our last abstainers meetup at Café Algiers.

Andala Café is an underestimated gem of Central Square. They have a porch and a patio. 2 floors. Affordable, no pressure to order, but please do order something (if just a Capuccino or Turkish coffee) & tip.
  
I get comments saying (rightly so) that all I schedule are pub events. Well this is for coffee or tea tipplers.   
  Great atmosphere you boozers are missing out on. No booze! and we're not sorry!

results.name: Meetup for Abstainers

results.description:
Inspired by the Polyglot Club Paris weekly Polyglot meeting, Polyglot Club New England is a platform where where polyglots, linguists, language lovers, travelers and expats meet and enjoy speaking in different languages.

Love languages? Yes we do! Many have expressed that they have been looking for a group like this. Come help create a vibrant language learning community in our area!


You can practice any languages you have in common with other attendees, or share your experience learning languages so that others may benefit.


Note: Please be sure to RSVP if you are coming, and cancel your RSVP if you can't make it.   The locale is right across from the Kendall Square T.

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter at The Hawthorne Building, the large glass doors to the left of H&R Block.

Vanessa

results.description:
Join the Fresh Pond Walking Community for our regular Sunday walk around Fresh Pond.   

Let's join regular walkers from surrounding towns + members of five other walking groups and 20+ walkers for this walk.  Walk is on, Rain or Shine.

Few things are more enjoyable than a nice walk and a chat at the end of a busy weekend.

Since May 2012, we've met with a few other meetup groups Let's join for a stroll in a beautiful setting.

We walk clockwise, so if you get there late, just start walking counter-clockwise and you'll run into us.

Parking on Huron Avenue is easy, since the "Permit Parking" rules don't apply on Sunday - just park in any spot on Huron Ave, there will be plenty of them.

If you're coming by bus, take the 71 or 73 bus from Harvard Square and get off at Aberdeen Ave. Walk all the way up Aberdeen until you come to Huron Avenue, we'll be there.

Afterwards, we'll go out for dinner. We usually go for some unusual Chinese food, and the total cost is about $10 per person.

If you have trouble finding us, call me at[masked]
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 5/15  6:30

group.name: Boston Late Risers Hiking/Walking/Biking Social Meetup

results.description:
Join The Oldest Established Permanent Floating Community Walk in Cambridge 

For the 200th consecutive Sunday, we will be walking.   Let's join 20 or so others from other walking groups for this walk.

The walk is on, rain or shine.


Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.


Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

We'll all go out for dinner afterwards, somewhere in the neighborhood.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 5/15  6:30

results.description:
<a href="http://atwysbostonspeeddate.eventbrite.com/"></a>

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  An icebreaker will be provided to held facilitate mingling. Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>

results.description:
This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join other fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 ADMISSION INCLUDES:

*Light Appetizers

*Ice Breaker

*Amex Gift Cards for Ice Breaker Winners

*Supplies/Name Tags

PRE-PAY HERE: http://mixnmatchboston.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have an ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

Ice Breaker game with prizes -Full menu is available (pay as you go)  -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

results.name: SpeedMeeting- Singles Ages 27-37 - SOLD OUT FOR MEN

results.description:
The choice of topic this time is in honor and remembrance of The Artist Formerly Known as Prince, who subsequently changed his name to the above unpronounceable symbol (a friend of ours has suggested that it be introduced into the Unicode international character set), and who sadly left us recently at the young age of 57 (yikes - looking at driver's license).

While I suppose one can't rule out a certain amount of attention mongering and political posturing with the name change stunt, his spoken reason for it is quite understandable:

"The first step I have taken toward the ultimate goal of emancipation from the chains that bind me to Warner Bros. was to change my name from Prince to the Love Symbol. Prince is the name that my mother gave me at birth. Warner Bros. took the name, trademarked it, and used it as the main marketing tool to promote all of the music that I wrote. The company owns the name Prince and all related music marketed under Prince. I became merely a pawn used to produce more money for Warner Bros... I was born Prince and did not want to adopt another conventional name. The only acceptable replacement for my name, and my identity, was the Love Symbol, a symbol with no pronunciation, that is a representation of me and what my music is about. This symbol is present in my work over the years; it is a concept that has evolved from my frustration; it is who I am. It is my name."

So to use that trite expression, what's in a name? What do names come to mean to us? Do you like your name? Hate it? Do you want to (or have you) changed it? Some countries (like Denmark) have rules that the name you choose for your baby has to be on an approved list or be approved by a government board. Is your name entirely yours, or is it something that is shared with others as a linguistic representation of you? How do you feel about nicknames - camaraderie building, or hurtful and marginalizing?

Let's discuss...hope to see you there :)

results.description:
Just knock on the door.

Ever want to go an an adventure to the beautiful beaches and lush rain forests of Costa Rica? Well, here is your opportunity. We're planning an amazing trip with 5 different levels of accommodations and an amazing array of adventures at your fingertips, at the most very affordable price. 


Right now the projected dates for our group are November 26th to December 3rd, but other dates are available. (I might be going in July as well. But Stacey goes down often.) More to come for Jan/Feb 2017. Just come for general info now and you can figure out which dates are best for you later. 

Each has it's pros and cons. It all depends on what you're looking for. But all are amazingly fun and you'll never forget this adventure. Guarantee it!!!!

And one thing you get on these that you won't get from any online booking site - and this is the best part: a meetup organizer that has experience in the area to show you a good time. It's like having your own local tour guide--because you do!!!!

.......................................


Please look at our 5 options below:

Option 1 - Surf Hostel 

Don't let the name fool you. This is Raw Costa Rican beauty at its best. Delicious food, gracious hosts, RIGHT on the black sand beach of rural of the Central American Coast.


(That was me enjoying my morning tea at the hostel last December)

Rustic yet clean and comfortable, and right on the beach.


The food is amazing and the staff is super accommodating and sweet. Still close to all the attractions and adventures. The door to this room is about 25 feet from where I had my tea in the top photo. Gorgeous!


...................................................................................................


Option 2 - OstionalTurtle Lodge. 

A step up. very clean upgraded accommodations in Ostional.  Very clean with AC and private baths.


...........................................................................

Option 3 - Azul Ocean Club 5 Star resort


 A luxury resort not far from these places and all the attractions with high end restaurants and accommodations. It's a 5 star, well-manicured resort close to all the activities and other venues so we can still play together.


...........................................................................

Option 4 - Surf House in Nosara

Nosara is a coastal surf community full of restaurants, night life, gorgeous beaches, and Costa Rican activities such as surfing, zip lining, yoga, horseback riding and a whole lot more. The advantage to this gem is that you're right in the middle of all the action. You will be able to walk to many of the activities you're looking for. This house is not a definite. It depends on how many people sign up and how quickly, which is why I am eager to get this ball rolling. The quicker you guys sign up and pay, the more likely it is that we land a nice house like this near the water.


..............................................................................


Option 5 - Adults Only 

All Inclusive Occidental Grand Papagayo Resort

Closer to the airport, this all inclusive offers one stop shopping for those who want a short commute from the airport and a more relaxing time away. Costa Rican adventures are still a step away, but this is for those of you who are looking for a less active and more "polished" vacation. 

..............................................................................

ACTIVITIES

In addition to these resorts are our activities. Some will be included depending on your package. All can be added.


Sunset horseback ride on the beach


Yoga with a view


Stand Up Paddleboarding....or sitting. Either way, the view is amazing...


Surfing Lessons 


Ever want to moon your friends in a rainforest waterfall? My sister took that shot. My shorts were falling off--no full monty here! Not with my sister...yuck!


Or Ziplining

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers, 


Let's enjoy a film from the 15th Annual Belmont Word Film Festival.  This event will showcase Brazilian film, Casa Grande (2014) (115 minutes) (with English subtitles), directed by Fellipe Barbosa.  

My dear friend, Maria, and fellow Boston Culture Lover member is on the committee for this festival.  I know that she and the committee work really hard in selecting the best films.  All the films that I have seen from this festival have been excellent!


This film is just one of many in the festival, for the complete schedule, go to www.belmontworldfilm.org/

The film starts at 7:30 pm, however I would like to meet the group at 7 pm at the lobby, so we can meet and greet before the film. 

*** This film will be preceded by an optional reception starting at 6:00 pm at the theater featuring Brazilian cuisine (additional $22 admission includes wines from Barton & Guestier). If you like to purchase tickets for the optional reception, please purchase your tickets online.  I will most likely be hosting this reception as a separate Meetup event, so stay tuned.  ***

Here is a brief description of the film:


Coming-of-age as rude awakening: one high school senior's dawning sexuality is shadowed by the discovery of his upper-class family's looming financial ruin. Polished and penetrating, Casa Grande renders a sharp social canvas of contemporary Brazil through the eyes of young Jean, who struggles with newfound knowledge of his racial and class privilege even as his parents, a failed hedge-fund baron and his sheltered wife, grasp at straws merely to survive.  http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/casa_grande/

To view the trailer, go to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6-ZLn3Lxcu8


To avoid the risk of this event selling out, I always recommend that you purchase your tickets in advance, you may purchase your ticket at http://www.ticketor.com/belmontworldfilm/tickets/casa-grande-4611?treferrer=Web 


* General admission is $11 and admission students and seniors is $9. 


Please only reserve "yes" if you are planning to attending.


For events to be successful and carefree, it is important for me to know who and how many people to expect. If you are a "no-show", a courteous message is expected.  A consistent of history of no-shows and lack of courtesy may cause members to be removed from the group. 


If you reserve "yes" and your plans change, no problem, I only ask that you change your reservation to "not attending".  

I will reconfirm details as we get closer to date of the event.


I look forward to enjoying this event with the group. 

Joana

results.name: Casa Grande - Belmont World Festival Film from Brazil

results.description:
This Build Your Brand orientation is intended to walk potential and current PGN leaders through the art of using PGN as part of the process of creating and building up a brand (e.g., a presence, an identity, a business, a reputation) that becomes well recognized within the larger personal growth community.  It approaches this from three perspectives: 


1) The new leader: You have a passion and want to explore whether you can develop it into something concrete via PGN

2) The senior leader: You have already developed a reputation in your current circles and are interested in offering your work to the larger community.


3) The aficionado: You love a particular type of work (perhaps a workshop series offered in a different part of the world) and would like to bring it to Greater Boston.

Topics

- How to start building your brand
- Leveraging your PGN events
- Leveraging your community
- Success factors
- Hub and spokes
- Interfaces between your brand and PGN

About Building a Brand

Many potential leaders would like to build a reputation that can turn into filled workshops, private practice clients, and more satisfied participants.  PGN is quite interested in supporting your efforts in this area.   However, throwing events onto PGN and simply hoping it all works out is probably not going to be the most effective way to build the best reputation -- in marketing parlance -- to build your brand.  This orientation looks at ideas that might help you build your brand more consciously, more quickly, more conscientiously, and more effectively.


About Leadership on PGN

PGN leaders are members of PGN who offer social, practice, or workshop events on PGN.  PGN leaders create over 200 events a year.  

One of the main goals of the Personal Growth Network is to identify and support members who can create personal growth events for the community -- to help them become leaders.  PGN as an umbrella organization is determined to help these leaders succeed so that the community can grow even more abundant.

Any member of PGN may offer an event on PGN, sharing their journey, their gifts, their joy, their successes, their vision, or their interests with like-hearted PGN members. 

PGN offers such leaders a toolbox of software, of coaching, and of support to help create successful events that benefit themselves and the membership.  For leaders determined to build something more permanent than just a few events, PGN offers support like this orientation.

About the Personal Growth Network

The Personal Growth Network is a first-of-its-kind meta-organizer, bringing together diverse personal growth and positive psychology tools and techniques that are designed to help generally healthy people create greater joy and more success in all parts of their life.  Members can try out, learn, and practice numerous approaches; they can select some approaches for more in-depth study and application to their lives; they can practice, support, and share a particular approach with other members; and they can return to PGN to explore different approaches or to work on other parts of their life.  

PGN is also a community of like-hearted people who share an important, but not widely distributed, combination of values and characteristics (e.g., curiosity, willingness to learn, willingness to change habits) around consciously and proactively crafting a life well-lived.  For people with this important combination of characteristics, engaging with other members of the community can be fascinating, supportive, and affirming.

PGN is a toolbox with which members can create successful events.  Members can create workshops, practice groups, and social events through which they can share their journey, their gifts, their joy, their successes, their vision, and their interests.

And finally, PGN is a marketplace, where leaders uncover numerous ways to serve more people more profoundly and more effectively.  They can offer their service broadly, discover and try out new techniques, tools and approaches, find out what works best for them, and iterate towards excellence.

About the Orientation Series

Given the enormous ambition and power of the Personal Growth Network, and its rapid growth, it is easy to feel a little overwhelmed at first, so we offer some "How-To" guides to maximize your utilization of the Personal Growth Network for whatever your goals may be.  

Our Orientations include: 

For Participants 
- Newbie Introduction: Thu Jun 16
. . . . . . . . . (For new, infrequent, or curious members) 
- User's Guide: Tues May 31, or Thu Jul 28
. . . . . . . . . (For active members of PGN) 
- Advanced User's Guide: Thu Jun 30, or Wed Sep 7
. . . . . . . . . (Heavy users customize PGN to their needs.)
. . . . . . . . . (Reducing emails and focus on your edge) 

For Leaders 
- Intro to PGN Leadership: Mon Aug 1
. . . . . . . . . (For members considering offering events) 
- Create an Event on PGN: Thu Sept 1
. . . . . . . . . (For members ready to offer an event) 
- Build Your Brand: Sun May 15, or Thu Sept 29
. . . . . . . . . (For leaders who want to build a recognized 
. . . . . . . . . (and desired brand in the community.) 

(Note: Leaders should all be Advanced Users of PGN.)

Office Hours
- Community Office Hours: Sun May 22
. . . . . . . . . (Bring any question, concern, or comment 
. . . . . . . . . (and we'll work it out together.)

About This Particular Orientation:

There is no prerequisite to take this orientation, although it may be very useful to have taken the User's Guide orientation, the Intro to Leadership orientation, and the Create an Event orientation. This orientation will assume that you understand concepts introduced there.

This orientation is conceived for leaders who want to create a strong reputation within the community.  


I will also try to address any specific questions that you post below. 

About The Webinar Technology:

This orientation is offered as a "Zoom Webinar".  This means that you will need a computer, and you will need to be in a location where you can listen and watch without distractions.  (There will be opportunities for video discussion as well, so you may want to look presentable, at least from the waist up. ) 

The webinar software used is Zoom.  It runs on most platforms.  If you have not run it before, please click on the link a half-hour before, to ensure that it is working on your system.

The link will be sent to you the day before the event.

results.description:
This is a friendly monthly reminder to contribute $11 yearly to help us pay off the yearly Meetup Group fee and additional cost to run the group and keep the group going. This is more for member's information and is not meant to sound that I am angry. Also, note that  Biagio is NOT getting rich from the group fees.  This is a YEARLY fee and NOT a monthly fee.

I wanted to address any crazy rumors and incorrect assumptions that I am getting rich from Meetup. These assumptions are based on having ALL 9,000 members paying the $10 a member fee which would equal $90,000, but that is 100% incorrect. I am not making $90,000 a year for this group!

So please let me clarify less than 1% of the group’ members actually pay the $11 yearly Voluntarily Donation. Out of that $11 PayPal take their cut so I only get  $10 per member. I barley take in $200 a year and that is NOT enough cover the yearly Meetup fees and the other Meetup expense like printing out Meetup materials, supplies for the group, batteries, games, Meetup business cards, etc. Over the past 6 years I've acquired over $2000 of debt to run this group and cover Meetup expenses. So it is time to understand the truth and stop making assumption.

Biagio is pretty Poor and Not rich. Luckily, there hasn’t yet been a need for me to start to begging for money on the side of the street……….. yet!

I am now paying Meetup a $200  fee  every year to run the group. In 2015 we have only collected $150 from members for the Meetup Group Fee so far, and we have not paid off the 2014 debt which is over $500 now. If we cannot get members to pay off the 2014 and 2015 debt  then I’m just going to let the group shut down due to lack of  funding when the 2016 payment is due.

Don’t forget,  I pay for batteries, supplies,  printouts,  signs, games, stands  etc. etc. to run this group its over $700 a year,  which includes the $200 a year Meetup fee!

So please be informed and realize what it takes to run a group this large. Oh and add to that I spend 30+ hours every week of my own time running the group which I get paid $0 for.

Please help keep the group going. Don’t let not giving $11 a year, every year stop all the fun. Oh and you don’t have to pay the $11 online you can pay the $10 in person or e-mail me to pay by check.

If you want to pay online Meetup has shut down the Amazon payment feature so you can now pay using Paypal and pay $11 to my PayPal account using e-mail address which is [masked]

=======================================

results.description:
Displaced: How International Law can Protect Migrants, Refugees, and International Security

A Harvard University JFK School of Government Belfer Center Brown Bag Seminar - Open to the Public - Event link HERE. Coffee and tea provided. Everyone is welcome, but admittance will be on a first-come, first-served basis. 

May 16th, 12:15-2pm - Belfer Center Library, Littauer-369

Speaker: Jill Goldenziel, Research Fellow, International Security Program

:: :: ::

How can international law better protect both international security and the human rights of people fleeing violence? International refugee law protects only the refugees: those fleeing across borders due to a well-founded persecution on the basis of race, religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group. The world's other 42.3 million people displaced by violence have few protections under international law. 

This presentation will argue that the refugee and migration crisis has resulted not only from intractable violence, but from the world's failure to manage it. It will then propose and sketch new international law to address this crucial human rights problem. A new Displaced Persons Convention would better protect the human rights of individuals fleeing violent conflict and state failure, further state interests, and improve international security. 

Contact: ISP Program Coordinator, International Security Program - 79 John F. Kennedy St., Mailbox 53 Cambridge, MA 02138 - Belfer Center for Science and International Affairs - Harvard Kennedy School

Email: [masked] - Phone:[masked]
results.name: International Law & Migrants (HKS)

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Have you ever gotten an email that annoyed you? Wonder if you’ve ever written an email that has annoyed someone else – and maybe someone you were trying impress, rather than annoy?

Diane Darling can help. As one of the premier networking consultants in the United States, she knows how important email is for building connections. But she also knows how overwhelming email has become for everyone.

Many busy professionals find that “checking email has become synonymous with working, to the point where it seems to be taking over our working lives,” as Fortune observed in a 2012 article. The “average knowledge worker” spends 28 percent of his or her time managing email. The research group Radicati found that last year, the average business user sent and received 122 messages a day. And the trend line is only going upward.

To make sure your messages hit their mark – get noticed, opened, read, and acted on – attend this interactive, participatory workshop. You will learn from Diane how write an effective email. And you’ll learn what mistakes to avoid.

Among possible topics to be covered:

• How better subject lines can help

• How you can be both concise and complete

How you can recognize the limits of email, and know when to make a phone call instead or even ask for a meeting

The cost is $45 for members and first time attendees. All others are $55. Late registration for members is $55 and $65 for all others. Please remember to go here to register <a href="http://spconsultants.org/event-2193796"></a>http://spconsultants.org/event-2196402 or bring a check or cash to the event.

Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Monday Water training

results.description:
For the week of Together 2016 festival we invite you to visit the Mmmmaven Recharge Lounge. It will open Monday, May 16th through the 22nd as your place to meet festival-goers and the Together team, listen to local DJs, power up, relax, and hydrate before the evening's festivities. Don't miss hands-on interactive workshops with leading music technology brands, like Novation, Ableton, and Denon more. Check out full schedule here.

Join the conversation with Mark Van Bergen, author of Dutch Dance on the history and international origins of electronic dance music in party culture both in America and the Netherlands (1970-present). He'll be speaking with Bob Diesel, Boston's own encyclopedia of knowledge. Moderating the discussion of the history of the sound will be Together Creative Director David Day.

Mark van Bergen (1975, The Netherlands) is one of the major connaisseurs of dance music and culture in this small but scene dominating country. What started with dj-ing and dropping parties at the time house music entered nightlife (at the same time he did), is now a full specialism. As a journalist, Mark has been writing about dance music and party culture since 2000 (newspapers, magazines and now for his own founded blog Our House). He interviewed most of the key players in the scene and visited dozens of major events – mainstream and underground.In 2013 he released his first book: ‘Dutch Dance’, about 25 years of the infamous scene in his country. This first overview story of dance music/culture in The Netherlands was rewarded with the Pop Media Price, the most important award for music journalism in Holland. Since 2014, Mark is also a lecturer on Dance Industry at Academy for Creative Industries in his hometown Tilburg. He runs the Dutch Dance Industry Lab, in which all dance related activities of this high quality, internationally focused academy are collected.

</a>

Follow Together on <a href="https://twitter.com/together">Twitter, Instagram, & Facebook!

<a href="http://togetherboston.com/2016-schedule/"></a>
results.name: AMERICA & THE NETHERLANDS: A HISTORY OF DANCE MUSIC

results.description:
Jefferson the Architect

Registration required. Register HERE ($20) … (scroll down).

Monday, May 16th, 6-7pm - pre-talk reception at 5:30pm

Henry Adams, Case Western Reserve University

:: :: ::

Thomas Jefferson was not just the author of the Declaration of Independence and the third President, but he was also an influential architect in the early republic. Although he is best known today for the design of his own house, Monticello, Jefferson was very important as a champion for and scholar of neoclassical design. His plans for the Virginia State Capital and the University of Virginia helped define how Americans thought of public spaces for the following century. Henry Adams will explore the impact of Jefferson in American architecture and the legacy he has left on our country's built environment.
results.name: Jefferson ... Architect

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the unpaved municipal parking lot to the left of 72 Jefferson Street
results.name: Marlborough Couch to 5K - Spring 2016

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
